boardgame.name: The Oath of the Eclipse: A New Paladin Oath
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Oath of the Eclipse, inspired by spiritual sisters of two warring tribes, represents not only something that is often common in mythology, but also in mortal psyche: the constant balance of aggression and passivity, of harm and healing.

boardgame.name: Hardboiled Follies: A Setting for DoubleZero
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Hardboiled Follies, you take on the role of a completely unqualified amateur detective. You and your friends avoid your real problems by taking on cases and going undercover to solve mysteries. Opposing you are the trained and licensed professionals of the Columbia Detective Agency. They who urge you to please stop what you’re doing before you get hurt. You know the truth is that they just hate having competition. You’ll show them.

Hardboiled Follies is inspired by every story where an ordinary person gets swept up in some nefarious plot. It’s an homage to all of those comedic fish-out-of-water thrillers where people are suddenly in over their heads, and all of those cozy mysteries where amateur detectives somehow prevail over trained police investigators. Part Murder She Wrote, part The Big Lebowski, it’s a more lighthearted take on the genres covered by the DoubleZero system.

Hardboiled Follies was designed to be used with DoubleZero Easy Mode.

This sourcebook contains the following chapters:

The City Proper - A lot of people say they’re from the City, but they’re actually from the suburbs or the boroughs or even a town that’s, like, an hour away. It’s not the same as being in the City Proper.
Amateur Detectives - An overview of the player character types available in Hardboiled Follies. This includes new options, restricted abilities, and other changes from the Core Book.
Columbia Detective Agency - The primary antagonists of Hardboiled Follies, this section covers their origins, what their goal is, and how they pursue those aims. It also includes notable members of the organization.
Rules Changes - Hardboiled Follies uses Easy Mode, so there is a recap of that rules option here. Professions that are not recommended for the setting, and skills that need to be considered.
New Equipment: Spy Gear - A word about weapons available to civilians, and notes on the acquisition and use of commercially available spy gear like listening devices, cameras, and night vision goggles.
Allies and Enemies - Full statistics for characters described in the Amateur Detectives and Columbia Detective Agency chapters. This includes a selection of supporting characters.
Creating a Mystery - Advice on setting up a simple mystery story for the player characters to solve. A breakdown of preparation, handling clues, and setting up the beginning, middle, and end.
Bibliography - Inspirations for this sourcebook, and recommended media to help establish the overall tone and intention of the setting. Use this section as fodder for adventure ideas and possible characters.

boardgame.name: MOLOCH: A Setting for DoubleZero
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Conspiracy and Political Intrigue Ripped from Tomorrow's News

In MOLOCH, players characters are members of an underground resistance movement fighting the machinations of a secret occult conspiracy determined to rule the world. Named for the folkloric metal that can harm malevolent supernatural creatures, the Cold Iron movement fights to wrest control of factual reality from those attempting to replace it with lies, disinformation, and propaganda.

In the 21st century MOLOCH a mystery cult comprised of privileged and wealthy individuals. Feeding upon human suffering, they seek to remake the world in their own image. The cult’s leaders view themselves as absolute monarchs, with the rest of humanity no more than servants, serfs and slaves at best. To further their own ends they control corporations, media outlets, and entire political parties.

This tabletop roleplaying setting explores the themes of compassion versus greed, selflessness versus selfishness, and critical thinking versus blind populism. It asks what constitutes good and evil in this modern era of divisiveness, falsehood, and social upheaval.

About the Setting
A version of this setting was previously published under the title Revelations in Cold Iron. Aside from the game system, there are other fundamental differences. That game takes a dark urban fantasy approach, where magic exists. This version leans into the political thriller aspect and is grounded in the real world, as befits the DoubleZero system.

boardgame.name: Spectres of Mars: A Setting for DoubleZero
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Cold War with Mars
Set in a gloriously retro-future 2068, Spectres of Mars follows the Cold War between Earth and the Strangers, a race of incorporeal Martians able to possess human bodies. When the first human explorers accidentally desecrate a sacred dead city on Mars, the Strangers vow revenge and launch a series of reprisals against Earth. These are countered by Myriad, a global defence organization created to root out alien infiltrators and terrorists.

Spectres of Mars is an espionage and counter-terrorism setting with a science fiction twist. Player characters are agents of Myriad, a joint operation of the United States, the Soviet Union, the United Kingdom, France, and Germany. It’s inspired by Gerry Anderson’s Captain Scarlet and UFO, the mythology of The X-Files, the film version of 2001: A Space Odyssey, and every conceivable version of Invasion of the Body Snatchers.

boardgame.name: Shrine of Serpents (SWADE)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Serpent's Servants Awaken!

The sinister serpent cult of Apep the Devourer has returned! Once hunted to near-extinction to quell their insatiable hunger for living sacrifices to their scaled god, a new power has arisen claiming to be an avatar of the dreaming serpent and has redoubled their rapacious campaign of terror with an inhuman cunning and savagery. Content to lurk in the shadows no longer, the serpent cult must be stopped before it spreads once more across the Pharaoh Kingdom and the sands again are stained with blood and venom while their mysterious master laughs.

Shrine of Serpents is a Savage Worlds Adventure Edition (SWADE) adventure for the Veteran characters and is an ideal sidetrek adventure for heroes in search of lost lore or exploring the dusty ruins of a fallen civilization, especially one inspired by the legends and lore of ancient Egypt.

boardgame.name: Tavern of the Grumpy Wizard
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enraged after being kicked-out of his favorite tavern - it happens to everyone, the grumpy wizard cast a spell spoiling all the food - causing them to GO BAD!. Get in there, clean the place up, close that medieval fridge (harder than you think!), and see what you can do about that spell.

What do you get for loose change you could probably find on the couch?

Play at home by yourself or on our Discord server with a friend - or three.
A brand new tavern map riddled with over-sized, spoiled food! Nom-Nom!
10 new, never before seen (you, know, new) Food Gone Bad monsters!
Boss Monster Eye Scream! He's so cute and friendly but just has a bad rep.
A second map for creating your own volume of danger squares!
Printable monster horde - won't eat up your ink! No nom-nom.
I think that's it.
(Yep, that was it.

boardgame.name: A Litany in Scratches
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some things are better left alone.

Corrupted by forbidden knowledge, the Monastery of the New Spring stands abandoned. In its courtyard, a tree feeds on the blood-soaked soil, animated by something evil in the catacombs beneath. When adventurers seek out the ruined monastery, they find that other looters have already arrived. That may be the least of their problems.

A Litany in Scratches is one of the Ennie award-winning Trilemma Adventures by Michael Prescott. This version contains the original dungeon, expanded to include ELEMENTAL stats and a flavorful cast of player characters with their own agendas and motivations.

boardgame.name: Embers of the Forgotten Kingdom: System Companion for the Shadow of the Demon Lord Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Discover the Forgotten and the Forlorn in your Shadow of the Demon Lord Campaign

This is a stats supplement to the Embers of the Forgotten Kingdom 'setting' book

Discover the tragedy of King Brennin,
the one who failed and broke the land,
and cast it into chaos.

In a land beset by the Endless Summer,
what will you do?
Bring an end to Brennin’s tragedy?
Seek an end to the curse?

Or perhaps… something else entirely?

If you are looking to emulate the Dark Souls or Soulsian style in your SotDL ruleset, this book will provide you with a number of rules options to bring your forlorn realm to life. In addition, there are detailed boss fights for the core characters of the Embers handbook, tailored just for Shadow of the Demon Lord.

This book does not contain the lore or background information about the characters from the Embers of the Forgotten Kingdom corebook.

boardgame.name: The Sunless Depths
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beneath the surface of the world, miles down into the crust, lies a network of dark caverns and twisting passages. These massive chambers and narrow crawlways form a vast underground habitat. Deadly monstrosities and extraordinary beasts make this darkness their home, evolving and adapting to survive within the pitch. Deep down where daylight has never penetrated, great wars wage and monstrous kingdoms flourish. Undead cities, and ancient ruins lie amongst mushroom forests and underground lakes. Yet, amidst the harsh surroundings, great spoils await the worthy adventurer.

The Sunless Depths are divided into nine geographically diverse regions, each with its own characteristics, inhabitants, and history.

boardgame.name: Eye of the Storm
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A recon mission goes horribly wrong as a group of modern soldiers face an ancient evil bent on stealing their very souls!

boardgame.name: Temple of the Snake Seers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are You Prepared For Your Next Session?

Short On Time Or Looking For Extra Content?

An Instant Adventure For Fantasy Roleplaying Games.

Temple of the Snake Seers: is an adventure designed for a standard group of 2nd to 5th level players. It follows a snake worshipping cult who has taken over the small village of Olstone. It features a low-level dungeon that could easily be adjusted for higher levels and a small village ripe for expansion and possible future adventures.

Designed for a group of 4-5 players with low to mid-level characters. Use as a standalone adventure, connect to an existing campaign, or as a random encounter in a pinch!

boardgame.name: The Postulant
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An injured but love-struck young man hires the heroes to rescue his paramour — a girl whose family hates him and tried to have him killed — from the religious redoubt they shipped her off to as punishment for her sneaking around to see her beloved behind their backs. As the team sets out on their seemingly simple mission, however, destructive forces fueled by hate are gathering to deny the lovers’ happiness once and for all. And the unaware adventurers may be simply another obstacle to be dealt with.

The Postulant is a short adventure for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG.)

boardgame.name: Lifeform Reading: Xxn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some worlds in the interstellar government are what humans consider overcrowded; in many cases, this is the result of a small world with an overwhelming immigrant population that relocates to it for whatever reason. But sometimes, the native sapients have a birthrate that is so out of control that the local biome can barely cope without extraordinary biological measures.

One such planet was discovered early in the interstellar government’s history, but initial contact wasn’t peaceful. In fact, the first survey crews arrived as the entire planet was undergoing what could only be described as a brutal, cannibalistic war as the inhabitants — a sapient arthropodal species — fell upon one another with abandon. Only after a year did the violence die down enough to allow the interstellar Scouts the chance to contact the natives…who welcomed the strangers warmly.

Over time, the Scouts learned that the natives, called Xxn (the closest that human vocal structures can approximate the sound) are a xenophilic people whose population and breeding pressures periodically drive them to kill one another as a biological imperative to control their population.

Lifeform Reading: Xxn is for 2D6 science fiction games such as Cepheus Engine and The Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG), although it’s usable with other systems with a little work.

boardgame.name: Lifeform Reading: Xorn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Xorn are triradial beings from a dense planet orbiting a red dwarf flare star. Their adaptations to the harsh environment have endowed them with several advantages, including claws used for rapidly burrowing and the ability to sense vibrations. Their social makeup makes them suitable for small group hierarchies such as adventuring parties. Now Referees can add these interesting creatures from the World's Original Fantasy Roleplaying Game to their Cepheus Engine and Original Science Fiction Roleplaying games. Includes a discussion on their psychology and physiology, and variant stats for using them as mere animals and as a sapient alien race.

boardgame.name: A Dozen Distressing Rumors
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Building on the many, many rumors that have already been written for the A Dozen . . . series of PDFs, the twelve rumors within these pages offer up more of the same. More full-page concepts that the gamemaster may use as the basis for a new encounter, a new adventure, or maybe just as background flavor to add depth to the campaign.

As always, each rumor includes a basic bit of info to set the scene and also details both a true and false result, giving the GM ideas on where the rumor may take the action during gameplay.

boardgame.name: Rogers Honk My Horn!
boardgame.description:
VIZ Profanisaurus Card Game. A sweary foul-mouthed adult card game based on guessing entries from the Profanisaurus. Players take it in turns to pass the horn and read out entries from a card. When reading out the card, the horn is used wherever it's suggested as a 'blank'. The 'blank' is the same for all three entries on each card.

The other players shout out their guesses to what the blank word could be. First to so many cards wins.

boardgame.name: A Dozen Frightening Rumors
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Following the model set in the A Dozen Sinister Rumors and A Dozen Troubling Rumors titles, the pages that follow offer you, the gamemaster, a story hook that you can elaborate on to create your own adventure. In addition to the setup, each entry also offers suggestions on treating the rumor as true or false. Note that these are suggestions only; if your own imagination spins off in a new direction as you read the rumor, then feel free to run with your idea and make the work your own! What matters most to be is that you take inspiration from these works and that every PDF in this series helps you to add depth to your personal campaign.

boardgame.name: A Dozen Terrifying Rumors
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now that there are over thirty entries in the modern series of A Dozen . . . PDFs, I find that some of my favorite to write are the various rumors titles. Why is that? Because they give me the chance to create one-shot, entertaining scenario ideas that – I hope! – gamemasters find useful both as background noise and, at times, the skeleton of a complete game session.

boardgame.name: Action Movie Physics
boardgame.description:
Get ready for action!

Action Movie Physics is a game built to emulate your favorite action movie! Like an action movie, Action Movie Physics is fast moving, often violent, and not entirely based in real world physics (hence the name).

With Action Movie Physics, it is your turn to be the hero! Create a character and learn what happened in your early life to lead you to become the hero you are now. Choose skills, get some hero points, and you're ready to save the world!

Action Movie Physics features action-packed combat, harrowing chases, and evil villains!

Are you ready to be a hero?

(from DTRPG blurb)

boardgame.name: The Clay Shelf
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE CLAY SHELF is a setting or adventure site for Into The Odd: Electric Bastionland, set in the Deep Country, far from Bastion.

Set years after the catastrophic collapse of the Presa Dam, which flooded new and ancient cities alike.
The formerly glittering city of Indigo plays host to nefarious industrialists and prospectors. Something powerful lies hidden there in plain sight.
Flat Bandits roam the plains, infused with resources from a mysterious alliance. They have spies everywhere, though their activities haven't gone unnoticed.
The Justicewomen try to keep the peace, even as their numbers dwindle.
Within the husk of an enormous beetle, refugees from the flood have banded together with the few remaining native Idir people to form something new.
In Bastion, Machineries are disappearing from the Underground, and then popping up as slave miners in the Shelf.
Something awful has laid waste to the Northern town of Black Spot. Slowly but surely it is moving South, leaving carnage in its wake.

boardgame.name: The Positronic Library
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Positronic Library is a simple dungeon for Into The Odd: Electric Bastionland, and other rules-lite OSR games.

boardgame.name: Thaumaturgic Codex Book III: Magic Items
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This file features 34 innovative magic items for your 5th edition D20 RPG. Many of these items first appeared in the Heroes Handbook back in 2003. They have now been updated and adjusted for use with the most recent edition of the D20 system.

Within this file you will find amazing and useful magic items such as:

Blanket of Solace: Protects you from the cold and from your enemies!

Compass of Direction: This handy compass finds a lot more than magnetic North!

Headband of Thought Projection: Create 3D images of your thoughts!

Net of Negation: The perfect weapon for anyone hunting witches, wizards, or sorcerers!

These and 30 more unique and useful magic items can be found within these pages. Pick up this file today and bring some high fantasy heroics to your campaign setting!

boardgame.name: Dungeon Vault Magazine (No. 10)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is issue No. 10 of Dungeon Vault Magazine. A compilation of adventures, lore, excellent cartography, and useful digital goodies.

Dungeon Vault Magazine is all about providing interesting ideas and lore to DMs and storytellers. Within this issue, you will find varied adventure ideas.

These short modules do not stick to a unified template of sections. Instead, they are organically created and follow their own pace. The types of modules you can expect are city/town settings, regional settings, dungeons, outdoor locations, encounter maps, and one-page adventures.

The modules are written with the 5th ed. OGL in mind but rules are often left to a minimum. Most adventures are appropriate for low to mid-level (Levels 1 to 10) adventur­ing parties. We include a note at the beginning of each adventure with a ballpark estimation of party level and playing time.

boardgame.name: Cepheus Atom
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The bombs fell. Nations wielded varied and monstrous weapons against one another. Fires, clouds of poison, and worse have swept the world. Now only the savage Wastes remain: haunted by mutants, deranged robots, and genegineered monstrosities. But from the fire, heroes and villains rise: tribals, survivors, mutants, all the warped remnants of Humanity. Armed with primitive weapons, pre-Collapse artifacts, and afflicted by strange mutations, they set forth to conquer the wastes, or at least to survive them. By spear and laser, they shall prevail – or die a horrible death.

Cepheus Atom is a lightweight role-playing game where players assume the roles of survivors exploring a sci-fantasy post-apocalyptic world. This is, as some people call it, a “gonzo” apocalypse – expect sentient mutant animals and plants!, death-ray guns, and wild mutations, rather than the grimmer darkness of a more realistic apocalypse. The rules are designed for fast, “beer and pretzels” play, where players roll dice and blow up stuff between bites of pizza and sips of soft drink, all while enjoying an evening with friends.

All you need to play are this booklet, a few six-sided dice, writing supplies, and your wild, mutated imagination!

boardgame.name: Frozen Depths
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Duet Adventure for PCs of levels 4-5

Plunge into a frigid mine
to rescue an eager summoner in over her head.

Having a famous explorer for an aunt makes for a long shadow to grow up beneath, especially if you're the youngest dwarf of five siblings, desperate for a way to prove yourself.

However, a few days ago, Glabrobelle, a young dwarven conjurer, and her penguin "familiar" uncovered a unique opportunity to test her newfound powers.

Her worried aunt, the ranger Rangwynn Frostbraid, seeks out the party and requests their aid in recovering her niece. The curious girl has disappeared into a partially underwater mine! Can they brave the icy waters and fish her out?

What's included with the adventure PDF:
This one-shot adventure includes two new NPCs, a unique creature, and a new magic item. You'll also find a detailed map of the partially underwater mine.

boardgame.name: Super-Powered Fate
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The supplement nobody asked for--ANOTHER super-power system for Fate players everywhere.

Get the gang together! No new rules to learn (well, maybe a couple but they're basic). No long lists of power mods to paralyze you with indecision. Describe your superhero concept, get buy-in from the group, write them up in minutes building on Fate Rule #1: Aspects are always true, and start playing.

Super-Powered Fate is a compact (23 page) guide to the free-form description of superhuman powers with Aspects, Skills, and Stunts, written for Fate Condensed and compatable with Fate Core.

It includes:

A discussion of character-creation choices balancing Aspects, Skills, Refresh, and Stunts for superhero campaigns.
An examination of Setting Rules (Power Scale, Collateral Consequences, etc.) especially appropriate to supers games.
Step-by-step instructions for using Character Aspects as Power Aspects, choosing Skills (or creating new Power Skills), and fleshing out powers with Stunts.
A review of the original Fate Skill List, with suggestions on how each Skill may work with a superhuman power.
A collection of Stunts especially useful for super-powered play, with guidelines for creating more Power Stunts.
10 superhero archtypes as templates for building Power Aspects, Skills, and Stunts.
4 Fully worked sample characters, used as character-construction examples throughout.

boardgame.name: Campaign Codex #1: Classic Foes (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment presents barbarians, brigands goblin warriors, hobgoblin warriors, kobold warriors and orc warriors.

About Campaign Codex
Presenting stat blocks, variant stat blocks and a slew of other easy-to-use material to personalise and bring to life your NPCs the Campaign Codex line does the hard work so you can focus on crafting a memorable and enjoyable game for you and your friends.

boardgame.name: Campaign Codex #1: Classic Foes (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment presents barbarians, brigands goblin warriors, hobgoblin warriors, kobold warriors and orc warriors.

About Campaign Codex
Presenting stat blocks, variant stat blocks and a slew of other easy-to-use material to personalise and bring to life your NPCs the Campaign Codex line does the hard work so you can focus on crafting a memorable and enjoyable game for you and your friends.

boardgame.name: Legendary Bards
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

All the World's a Stage!
Legendary Bards is the latest volume in our new series of player-focused supplements, this time focusing on the performing dilettante: the bard. The bard blends magic, martial prowess, and a mastery of skills to allow the character to support their party in a variety of ways both in and out of combat. Legendary Bards is designed to further build on this concept, rebalancing the class to select the performances they wish to take and specialize their character to fulfill any niche their party may need.

Using their Bardic Performances the legendary bard can select a wide variety of different abilities they can use to bolster their allies or bring despair to their foes, while their new Bardic Schools allow them to further customize themselves to better fit a variety of concepts and niches. In addition, a collection of new archetypes allow the legendary bard to further customize their strategies and techniques, such as the Scholar of Legends focusing primarily on spells or the Warrior Poet removing their ability to cast completely in exchange for greater martial prowess.

boardgame.name: Fat of the Lamb (OSE)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Hunger Must be Sated
Will you survive at the cost of your sanity?

Nerwig Whal stands upon a tall bluff, wind buffeting and blowing his cherry red hair. He clears it from his eyes. To the west, a long line of wagons winds its way towards him. It ascends further and further into the hills and will eventually come to a stop at the appointed place: A site ordained to produce fortune - or so he thinks. “These miners have few options for supplies,” he said. “It takes a bold man to claim a stronghold in these harsh hills … but we will do it. And we will be the sole supplier in these here hills. And we will laugh all the way to the bank!” Fat of the Lamb can be used in conjunction with other modules, with a different campaign, or as a one-shot adventure. Inside Fat of the Lamb you will find:

Suitable for characters of 1st to 3rd level;
A dark fantasy adventure of survival and difficulty choices;
Compatible Old-School Essentials (B/X), usable with any OSR fantasy game;
Mental horrors;
New Mechanics: Corruption & Mechanics.

boardgame.name: Orléans Stories Erweiterung
Orléans Stories Expansion: Stories 3 & 4
boardgame.description:
Orléans Stories Erweiterung is an expansion for Orléans Stories that contains two new stories to play through.

In the third story, "The Settlers", you go back to the beginnings of the settlement around Orléans. The hard-working farmers gradually expand their settlements with the help of old acquaintances such as craftsmen, monks, and scholars, and they have to face only minor skirmishes, which affect their otherwise quiet life a little. A story for all those who love the quiet construction without big disturbances from outside.

The fourth story, "England vs. France", differs quite a bit from the previous one: The age-old feud between these two countries serves as a basis for the clashes between the teams. Exactly four players are involved, two of them playing for France, the other two for England.

But who is who? This secret is revealed only in the course of the game, and often the surprise is big because one had bet on another competitor. Now it is time to quickly complete the common task and hope that the secret messages will also contribute to the victory in order to triumph in the end.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Title: Orleans Stories Expansion: Stories 3 & 4 Publisher: DLP Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Monasterium
boardgame.description:
In the early Middle Ages, the peak of ecclesiastical power, no fewer than five monasteries were founded in a beautiful valley with the aim of spreading the Word of God.

As the dean of a cathedral school, you try to accommodate the novices entrusted to you in the monasteries, thus building up an unmistakable reputation. According to your talents, you send novices to monastery buildings, to the chapel, or to the cloister. The intercession of influential personalities or other monks should not be underestimated. You can also fulfill the special missions of the monasteries and build on the stained-glass windows of your cathedral to enhance the fame of your school.

After the three-year novitiate, it will become clear who has been able to earn the most fame and glory with their helpers.

Monasterium (which is Latin for "Monastery") is a strategic game with an innovative dice mechanism that presents the players with ever new challenges. The game includes a double-sided game board: one side for the game for two and one side for 3-4 players.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

Draft dice to develop your medieval monastery into the best centre of ecclesiastical learning. Except there are a few twists to the drafting mechanism... This caught my eye at Spiel.digital in 2021 as one to try.

boardgame.name: Dogtags
Dogtags: Man to Man Squad Actions in the European Theatre
boardgame.description:
A bare-bones set of tactical miniatures rules for depicting squad- or platoon-level World War II actions, ostensibly in 1944 Europe. The only real tie that the rules have to the setting is a five-page list of game statistics for small arms used by combatants who fought in the European Theater. However, the abbreviated rulebook contains no scenarios, organizational info, or other historical background.

Each 15 or 25mm figure represents an individual soldier. Each soldier is rated on a characteristics sheet for various abilities: weapon, hand to hand (combat), throwing, recovery (from "shock"), and survival. During character creation these statistics are modified based on a National Characteristics chart which provides various percentage adjustments to weapon, hand to hand, and survival ability die rolls for German, British, American, Italian, and Russian troops.

—User summary

Precis Intermedia brings back this classic set of WWII miniatures rules. Originally published in 1978 by Wee Warriors, Dogtags is designed for action on a squad to platoon level, and may be played with 25mm or 15mm figures. Recreate the most difficult and demanding actions that were daily encounters for the long-faced G.I.'s of WWII. Enact small unit tactics with you as the NCO. Can you take a strong point without excessive loss to your fighting strength? And can you hold off that next German assault? You have to answer questions such as these from game to game as you learn the importance of tactics and a good NCO to carry them out. It's up to you to hold victory in your hands -- or just a collection of dogtags.

This piece of gaming history is a must for collectors, old school gamers, and those looking for a fast-playing WWII miniatures skirmish game. With the original on the extremely rare list, this classic reprint of Dogtags has been remastered for a clean print, and is readily available at a low cost.

Requires a set of percentile dice and a six-sided die (a four and eight-sided die are also needed on occasion).

—2020 description from the reprint publisher

In the grim darkness of the 41st Millennium, the Imperium of Man is assailed on all sides by rebellion, alien invasion and the bloodthirsty servants of dread and terrible gods. Yet there is one force that forever stands against these threats, one force whose destiny is an eternity of battle - the Space Marines. These superhuman warriors have safeguarded Humanity against the dark and hungary galaxy for ten thousand years. They have fought the most thankless of wars against the most terrible of foes, winning impossible victories when all around them have fallen. boardgame.name: Papellonae: An Insectoid Race of Day and Night
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep within the Feyforests they slumber, moths and butterflies the size of humans with their wings large and beautiful as they awake.
Papellonae are curious of what lies beyond their homes and some are gripped by an insatiable wanderlust. To satiate their curiosity some brave souls eventually left the Feyforests to explore the vast expanse of what lies beyond.

Papellonae are a humanoid race for 5th edition and take inspiration primarily from moths and butterflies. Whilst they share a curiosity for the strange and new, they prefer to keep separate from each other.

Dawn Papellona are what butterfly-folk refer to themselves as. They thrive during the day and carry a unique set of abilities that sets them apart from their night-dwelling counterpart.

Twilight Papellon are what moth-folk refer to themselves as. They prefer nighttime and within themselves they carry magic given to them by the moon.

Includes:

2 Races
6 Subraces (3 each)
1 Half-Papellonae Template
6 new feats

boardgame.name: Aventuras de 1 Página: A Super Queda!
Super Fall!

1 page adventures is a serie of adventures to you adapt to any RPG system. A perfect plot to start a new campaing or to put in between of your adventures in the most different worlds!


Aventuras de 1 Página é uma séria para adaptar para em qualquer sistema. Um plot perfeito para começar a jogar ou colocar entre suas aventuras, nos mais diversos cenários e ambientações!

boardgame.name: Grendel: A Half-Troll Player Race for 5e
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Grendel are a highly diverse race of Half-Trolls from the world of Voarcel. Why would you ever want to be a Half-Troll? Who in their right mind would ever want to be involved in making a Half-Troll?! First, don't Kinkshame, second, the Trolls of Voarcel are not quite the unpleasant cannibalistic monstrosities in other settings. Sticking to the edges of civilisation, these peaceful folk live in tribal communities spread across the land, trading with the various other mountain & wildland dwellers such as Goliaths, Minotaurs, Firbolg & more. They also have some of the strongest alcohol out there, and the parties they throw are some of the wildest and most memorable on the planet. Whether part of a trade deal, a very enjoyable night's celebration, or part of a long term protection agreement with a traveler looking for somewhere to hide, Grendel are a growing force in the world.

Included in this pdf are many different ‘sub race’ options for the Grendel based on their Non-troll parent. Dragonborn, Aarakocra, Elves and even Halflings, this wide variety of genes and racial traits is down to the Trolls and their ever mutable & adaptable blood. No two Grendel are alike, and each one retains the strongest traits of each parent. No longer do you need to fear Death Saving Throws (Unless Fire or Acid are around), as your hit points slowly recover over time (based on your proficiency modifier). With Long limbs, hardy constitutions and surprising speed, we promise the Grendel will make your next character highly memorable. Of course nothing comes without a price, and you may find most cities and civilised folk reaching for the pitchforks. Thankfully with your natural ability to disguise your form when outside of your inner circle, you should be able to make your way through most of these ‘social interactions’ reasonably stress free.

boardgame.name: The Church on the Hill
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The cleric regaled us with stories of the deeds performed by Sir Maron, then told us where he'd been buried after his death. We all thought it was worth a look - after all, great deeds are usually accompanied by great relics. The province where he was laid to rest is so odd, though. No one commits any crimes. No one gossips about their neighbours. Heck, no one really talks to anyone else. Every now and then, a villager will throw down their tools and leave the village, heading toward the Church on the Hill...

This is a system-agnostic dungeon designed to slot easily into whatever kind of campaign you might be running. Use it as a random settlement encounter or a local place of worship.

boardgame.name: Big Time WW2: Europe
boardgame.description:
In Big Time WW2: Europe, the six major types of combat units which fought across the continent are represented by wooden cubes – infantry, armor, artillery, AAA (anti-aircraft artillery), bombers and fighters. The game is light, playable, dice-driven and features two unique boards – a resource board and a battle board.

The resource board confronts the players with a clean, abstract method of obtaining resources, while two ten-sided dice often demand tough, exquisite choices. Do you take the armor unit or the AAA? Do you push your luck to get that bomber or risk losing the three units you have in production? A surprising twist is that some die rolls provide a resource for your opponent!

The straightforward battle board provides a different set of choices. Do you attack instead of gaining resources? Do you deploy a bomber in its staging area or your home base? A fighter in its bomber escort role or ground support? Combat is a breeze, with equal numbers of ground unit types in a battle removed from play before resolution. Most combat is a single round, avoiding excessive dice rolling.

The game can end in several ways: destroying your opponent’s infrastructure, having more VPs when the cubes run out, or by your opponent’s resignation.

Tension, excitement and fun are high in this inimitable war game!

Components:

60 Unit cubes
6 Infrastructure tiles
2 Ten-sided dice
1 Resource board
1 Battle board
1 Cloth bag
12 Unit Type cards
1 Rules

boardgame.name: Buried Bones
Buried Bones: Creating in the Realms of Pugmire
boardgame.description:
From the Back of the Book

Is Pugmire a joke?
No. Because it can be so much more - Eddy Webb.

Since the release of Pugmire, creator Eddy Webb has gotten a lot of questions. Is Pugmire a "funny" game? Can I play my favorite dog? What products inspired the game? How can I make my Pugmire game as authentic as possible?

Collecting a variety of internal documents, email exchanges, blog posts, and community content projects, Buried Bones is the ultimate guide to creating in the Realms of Pugmire. Whether you're making your own products for the Canis Minor community content program, want to make your personal Pugmire chronicle as accurate as possible, or are just interested in some of the behind-the-scenes details of the world, Buried Bones is the book to read!


The writer's guide shared with all Pugmire and Monarches of Mau creators



A number of blogs related to the Realms of Pugmire, rewritten for this edition



A handy guide to help people convert material from the 5E OGL to Pugmire or Monarchies of Mau



Answers to frequently asked questions about the lore of the world and the mechanics of the RPGs.

boardgame.name: Town of Tezald
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Deep in this forested town lies a workshop, its walls so thick few sounds can escape. Blood stains its floors and cells littered with soiled straw wait, empty. Cadavers are arrayed on workbenches before a glowing, red machine.
Two hidden exits lead outside, one through an old basement that is now being used for wine storage and another through a small home above.

Stores with lichen covered walls sell goods, mingling with homes and consultancies.

boardgame.name: The Ruined City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Carved deep into this abandoned city’s cliff lies a workshop, its walls so thick few sounds can escape. Blood stains its floors and cells littered with soiled straw wait, empty. Cadavers are arrayed on workbenches before a glowing, red machine.

Two hidden exits lead outside, where gargoyles leer down at ruined mist-shrouded houses and market stalls, far below in the valley.

Strong winds whistle through the parapet above, screaming around toppled chimneys and down narrow alleyways. Stores walls have collapsed now covered with lichen and flowers.

boardgame.name: Mad Professor's Hideout
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Carved deep into the city’s cliff lies a workshop, its walls so thick few sounds can escape. Blood stains its floors and cells littered with soiled straw wait, empty. Cadavers are arrayed on workbenches before a glowing, red machine.

Two hidden exits lead outside, where gargoyles leer down at smoke-shrouded houses and market stalls, far below in the valley. Muffled voices bounce off the cliff from the market below.

Strong winds whistle through the parapet above, screaming around chimneys and down narrow alleyways. Stores with lichen covered walls sell goods, mingling with homes and consultancies.

boardgame.name: Shadowfell Burial Chamber
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A shadowy path takes you out of the village and to this old burial site, it’s caretakers long dead it has been left abandoned by the new residents of this town and it’s original purpose forgotten. The corrupted forest has encircled the site, growing over the many tombstones and mausoleum that were built long ago.

A stone bridge leads you over to the central mausoleum where a large sarcophagi sits above a set of encircling stairs.

boardgame.name: Deadman's Mausoleum
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A gravel path takes you out of the village and to this old burial site, it’s caretakers long dead it has been left abandoned by the new residents of this town and it’s original purpose forgotten. The corrupted forest has encircled the site, growing over the many tombstones and mausoleum that were built long ago.

A stone bridge leads you over to a central mausoleum where in the center stands a large sarcophagi, above a set of encircling stairs.

boardgame.name: The Pnoll
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Eat trash with pride as you play a gross-but-lovable pnoll! This product is a fully illustrated, playable ancestry for Pathfinder 2nd Edition, complete with heritages like the trashtooth pnoll and ancestry feats like Garbage Fire and Play Dead.

boardgame.name: Labyrynthus
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So far in the North, the Labyrinth lies, from poured marshes in the very west to heated mountains fitting the world´s edge. Walls and courts were built by means of no folks and whispering secrets that no one has known.

The world of Labyrynthus is a place saturated with the magical energy of Ether. The power of this energy conditions reality, confusingly mixing space and time. In the exact center of the world stands a rickety tower, known as The Library, and to the north stands an infinite Labyrinth. Its crumbling walls are covered by moss and weeds, but beyond you can find countless corridors and galleries, acting as a trap for ethereal energy. Numerous adventurers travel to that place to unravel their mysteries, get their treasures, or capture the strange creatures that live there. Many have been the ones who have entered the Labyrinth, but few have returned.

The game of Labyrynthus is a cooperative role-playing board game. Players play different characters in the fantasy world of Labyrynthus searching of the mysteries and hidden treasures that the Labyrinth holds and against the creatures that live there.

The game system is immersive, the rules of the game are based on the very logic and sense of the world they recreate. The game also has a narrative character, because instead of relying on the characteristics of the reference sheets and tables, players use their imagination to bring the sense of actions and spins performed in the game. Through the modules and expansions of the game system, players will be able to go descending and discovering the mysteries that the world of Labyrynthus.

With this game guide, you will have all the necessary rules to play within the world of Labyrynthus.

boardgame.name: Inside the Labyrynth
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the "Inside the Labyrynth" scenario module, players enter the Labyrynth for the first time, discovering some of its secrets and confronting its inhabitants.

boardgame.name: Mother, There's Only One
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the "Mother there's only one" scenario module, the players must try to get a valuable reward by capturing some monstrous cubs, but will find the task is not as easy as they expected...
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Madre no hay mas que una

boardgame.name: Scape and Flight
boardgame.description:

In the "Scape and Flight" scenario module, the players must escape from a dangerous place while pursued by horrible beings.

boardgame.name: Imaginary Destination
boardgame.description:
Imaginary Destination is a board game for all ages based on a fun cruise ship journey across the sea. The board game provides a unique 8-day cruise ship experience.

Imaginary Destination is all about the cruising experience. Players pick Terminal and cruise Ports of Call cards and move their cruise ship pawns across the Caribbean Islands. The winner needs to complete the 8-day itinerary first.

boardgame.name: Book of the Underworld
boardgame.description:
From back cover:

The Dragon Empire is a thin slice of land above a vast world with its own rules and rulers: welcome to the underworld!
Will you find adventure or misery in Underland? Treasure or death in the kingdoms of the Hollow Realms? Truth or fatal illusion in the poisoned caverns of the Deeps?
While leaving room for your campaign’s own stories, we’ve uncovered some of the underworld’s secrets for 13th Age:
• The Domain of the Silver Folk, and their embodied underworld gods: She Who Spins in Darkness and He Who Weaves with Joy...
• The Four Kingdoms of the Mechanical Sun, warring over ever-circling golem artifacts that carry an underworld star...
• The mighty dwarven city of Forge, rallying point for the inevitable war to reclaim Underhome...
• Forgotten gods, a gnomish academy of magic, monsters, magic treasure, and more!
You’ll also find rules for traveling in the underworld — which include ways to make travel montages more interesting (and hazardous!) — and advice for GMs who want to create adventures and campaigns set in the world below.
The passage downward lies ahead. A chill wind rises from the depths. Mutter one last prayer to the Gods of Light, set your torches ablaze, and enter the underworld!

boardgame.name: Weird Wild West
boardgame.description:
The wild frontier is where fortune can be found... but where calamity will often strike. To better your odds, you’ve joined up with a gang of other sojourners, be they from far off lands or native to these parts. But what fortune are you seeking? Or, are you running away from something in your past?

Prove yourself in the mixture of saloons, brothels, general stores, banks, jails, and churches among a crowd of bandits, fortune seekers, outcasts, prostitutes, sheriffs, warriors, and cowboys and cowgirls.

-from the introduction

boardgame.name: Who Farted?
boardgame.description:
Who Farted? is the ultimate whodunnit game. A great party game to play with your friends (and enemies). It will leave you gagging for more!

The objective of the game is simple. You are all stuck in an elevator. The Farting Thieves are trying to escape. At
least one of them needs to make it to the ground floor alive and conscious.
The rest of the innocent bystanders are trying to make it to the ground without being rendered unconscious by the toxic farts! To do this, they must successfully bind and gag all the thieves.
Each person playing is given a secret role to play - some with special powers but most only with their wits and guile. This is a game of social deduction where you have to work out who people really are! Can you trust them?

This is a Mafia style game of social deduction. There is a narrator who controls the flow and action of the game. Players get the opportunity to interact and accuse each other of being a Farting Thief and vote to bind and gag a player (putting them out of the game). After each voting sequence the lift goes dark and the Farting Thieves get to "fart" and render unconscious another player. This continues until either the Farting Thieves escape or all the Farting Thieves are bound and gagged. Watch out for the Suicidal Pyromaniac!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: BYTE Roleplaying Game
BYTE Roleplaying Game Quickstart Rules Beta Version
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The BYTE Roleplaying Game is a new d8-based tabletop roleplaying game that comes with mix-and-match thematic modules to create your own setting or to design a ruleset to play in a world from any book, movie, video game, or TV series.

boardgame.name: Programmed Wargames Scenarios: Second Edition Revised and Expanded
boardgame.description:
A couple more scenarios and some of the earlier ones have been slightly revised. 19 scenarios and 2 mini campaigns suitable for any period and fantasy games.

Battles and campaigns for solo and multi-player wargamers -- with programmed enemy deployment, orders and responses for one or both sides.

Designed more for those who never had the chance to own the original book.

boardgame.name: Fantasy 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a smattering of maps featuring a large 44x34 grave yard and a variety of other town maps gridded at 22x17. These are perfect for Vtts and as always I included maps with grids and with out.

boardgame.name: Apocalypse Grab Bag 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a grab bag of 17 older maps that I've drawn. There were for a post apocalyptic fantasy game that I haven't had a chance to run. They are hand drawn, colored and unlabeled and being an older series don't necessisarily represent my current style of maps for VTT. Sizes may vary.

boardgame.name: Forest 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a 5 map pack of forest battle maps (3300x2550 px or 44x34 grid). It is draw at a 1/4 scale and designed with VTT in mind. There are 4 versions of each map: a day, night and with and with grid. I have included a bonus map in a slightly older style as well.

boardgame.name: City Pack 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Here we go a map pack with a bit of modern flair for you city going needs. Various sizes from 44x34 to 22x17 all of the m set up for VTT at 3300x2550 px. Buildings, a club/ casino as well as some damaged portions will give your players plenty of set pieces for encounters. Grid and non grid versions included as well as a day and night version of each.

boardgame.name: Cyber City 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

These cyber punk city maps are perfect for your cyber punk, scifi, space opera, Corporate vilany needs. All of the maps measure at 3300x2550 and are set to a grid size of 22x17. They are great for VTT. Included are 5 maps in 2 styles, with and without grid.

boardgame.name: C.O.R.E. Micro
CORE Micro
Creative Options Roleplaying Engine Micro Edition
boardgame.description:
Creative Options Roleplaying Engine Micro Edition

Publisher's blurb:

Stat your world in no time.

Expand your options in realtime.

The CORE system is built for shared creation of exciting sessions, and easily skinned for any setting.

Minimal Rules.

Maximal Possibility.

CORE produces emergent stories that are character-driven, dynamic, and unpredictable, with few rules to learn for players, and as much prep (or as little) as the GameMaster desires.

The CORE MICRO rules are built for easy skinning, allowing you to take your concept, or an existing fictional world, and bring it to the table quickly for collaborative play.


The system uses pools of d6s, with a single mechanic
Choose your Character Generation system: Point-buy, Templates, or Rolled
LifeShapers provide background stories & motivations for player characters
Progressive Character Generation produces characters who change as they develop
Skills, Gear & Actions are narratively interpreted, producing unique details.
Action Resolution is shared & interpretive, with a range of dramatic outcomes for every roll
Skin the system to bring your world to life, quickly and easily

boardgame.name: First Ascent
boardgame.description:
First Ascent is a rock climbing-themed strategic board game. The goal in this medium weight, competitive game is to gain the most points by climbing the best route up the mountain and becoming the most skilled climber! Each player assumes the role of a unique asymmetric character, and throughout the game they will be building their route up the mountain, managing resources, achieving objectives, and increasing their efficiency by accumulating skills and gear! This game is for 2-5 players and takes 45-90 minutes to play.

Gameplay overview:
In First Ascent, the goal is to gain the most points by creating the best route! Points are gained in four ways:
1) Climbing pitches — use your climbing skills, gear, water, and psych to pay the requirements to move on to a tile "climb the pitch". Draw a climbing card and resolve the events that may involve resource management, board manipulation, or selfish vs altruistic decisions. Each tile is worth 1-5 points with higher point value tiles requiring more resources.

2) Objectives — achieve shared and personal objectives that relate to the path of your route. Plan carefully and manage resources to execute the path that will contribute towards achieving your objectives.

3) Technique bonuses — the climbing skills and gear cards contain symbols representing climbing techniques of precision, power, balance, and pain tolerance. Match three technique symbols on the cards you play to climb a tile and earn +2 bonus points. These can add up significantly, so choose your resources wisely.

4) Summit — reaching the top of the mountain is great, but climbing is about the journey. Gain +1 summit bonus point for reaching a peak.

If you don't have the required resources to climb, you can "risk it" by rolling the risk dice to climb a tile for one less resource. You may get away with a check mark and succeed without consequence, roll minus two cards and give them to another player, or roll minus one card and one psych which you give to another player. As long as you have the assets to lose, you will climb the tile, but at a price.

When you begin to ascend the mountain start in any tile on the first row. Next climb to any adjacent tile and leave your rope behind to mark the route you've climbed. Two climbers can not occupy the same tile, except for a summit, so you may compete with other climbers on the mountain for the prime locations.

As you climb the mountain you will practice your skills and become a more efficient climber. The engine building component of this game grants you an "earned asset" after you play four cards of a specific skill type or gear. These tokens stay on your climber asset board and count towards fulfilling the required assets of future tiles.

This isn't a race to the top, its about creating a strategic route that will reward your cunning and planning. The game ends when a player has used all seven rope lengths and climbed their eighth tile.

Do you have what it takes to create the greatest First Ascent?

boardgame.name: Drinkopoly
boardgame.description:
The world’s blurriest game

Drinkopoly is a social and interactive board game designed to provide hours of fun, laughs and mischief at home, parties or outings. Don’t waste time thinking about party game ideas, just bring out the world’s most popular drinking game to break the ice and have an (un)forgettable experience with your friends.

The board has 44 fields with various tasks requiring you to stop at bars, pubs and clubs, and take gulps of long or short drinks. There are additional fields with special tasks and activities, such as truth and dares, arm wrestling challenges, poem recitals, tongue twisters, pick-up lines or kissing contests. The winner is the one who traverses through the social challenges and reaches the end of the journey first.

Drinkopoly has 50 special cards describing various tasks. When you pull a card, you have to complete the task or take a sip of a drink to advance further. Some of the tasks are funny, some are sexy and some are simply craaazy! You can be sure whichever card you pick, you will remember it (or not).

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Ducking High
boardgame.description: A "judge chooses best" ADULT card game full of crazy questions (225 in the first edition to be exact)that incite some long, out of this world conversations. Players choose responses from cards in their hand which were acquired from a random draw pile. A "judge" asks a question from on of their hand cards and then chooses a best response from all the responses that the other players played from cards in their hand. Players use their "ducking high" mind to think of funny, exaggerated and out of their mind but brilliant brilliant answers to mind bending questions. The game requires very little set up whose game length can be tailored to the players time constraints with a typical game allowing for each player to be "the judge". Game length depends on the number of players but is best with a group of three or more. An average game length is about 30 minutes, however, it has an addictive random response effect that can be entertaining for hours. Due to the nature of the game, obscenities and scenarios this game is recommended for adult groups.

boardgame.name: Kobolds on a Plane!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Rival Kobolds disguised as the famous Kobold chef Emerald and his kitchen staff visit your cave. The sneaky bastards arrange a cooking demonstration where they take your entire clan by surprise capturing you in a huge wooden cage. While dining on your clan leader in an epic-level BBQ and contemplating tasty new recipes for their Torg Foreman Grilles(tm), a strange Gnome arrives. He is Phil T. Olaf, an entertainer and entrepreneur. In exchange for two pairs of shiny boots, a bag of cheesy doodles, three Atomic Squash T-Shirts and a yummy Human baby, he acquires all of you! His plan is to transport you to a human zoo where you will be caged and put on exhibit as a rare type of prairie dog.

You are prisoners aboard Olaf's Gnomish airship, the Pike Maiden. Most of you have managed to claw through your crates and chew your way through the dunnage. You are ravenous and angry (well, that's normal). Find a way to escape your captivity while managing to live.

Animals such as monkeys, koalas, and squirrels come together to get some fruits from the Magic tree.

Players earn points depending on the picture tiles they collected.

boardgame.name: Dogs: Card Game
boardgame.description:
Dogs: Card Game was inspired by the original version, which has five editions, four in Brazil and one in the USA.

It offers a dynamic experience and very different from the board version.

The game plays up to 5 players, games are faster and the mechanics, although simpler, appeal to casual players to those more experienced in the hobby.

On his turn, the player chooses a place in the city to visit. There, he performs one or two actions in any order: (1) Collect dogs and (2) Hire a character. There are five different types of dogs: healthy, sick, trained, lost and looking for accommodation. The characters in turn improve the actions of the players: Kennel Manager, Trader, Veterinary, Handler and Partner.

With quick turns and varied play options, Dogs: Card Game is a lightweight set collection, with a hint of resource management and character selection, ideal for introducing new players to the hobby. In addition, it can also be played perfectly with children from 8 years old, with only a few adjustments to the rules.

boardgame.name: Loco Momo
Pstryk!
boardgame.description:
Locomomo is 2-4 player family game about using animals' movement to search their friends and take a group photo picture together.

Once upon a time, a group of lovely animals lived peacefully in an enchanted forest called Locomomo. They are rabbits, eagles, ducks, leopards and bears. One day, a mysterious camera was discovered in the forest, and everybody wants to own this interesting new toy. In order to find the camera a new owner, friends in the forest decided that whoever can take the prettiest photos with the camera would be the owner.

In the game, player will take turns by using animals on game board to find other related friends(Animal Tile). After that, player will have to arrange these animals into seats (Player Board) for a group picture (Scoring).

The game ends after 6 rounds. Player will score the points base on the scoring system on the Player Board. The highest point win the game and rewarded as best photographer in Locomomo.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: 1811: Albuera
boardgame.description:
1811: Albuera simulates this battle in lavish historical details using the "Fix Bayonets!" tactical system. The map was carefully drawn based on multiple historical sources while the unit counters sport the colors of the uniforms that were worn by those combat units that day. Two decks of Leader cards help you determine the order of activation of each of the armies' formations. Fix Bayonets! is a system simulating combat at the battalion level between the armies of the Napoleonic Wars. The rules include an emphasis on Command and Control, a card driven initiative activation system and limit the use of informational markers. The combat resolution system differentiates between the effects of fire, infantry assaults and cavalry charges. While not overly difficult, learning the game can be a challenging but rewarding experience for all wargamers.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Corruptopolis
boardgame.description:
In Corruptopolis you will put your knowledge to the test and learn about the main cases of political corruption in Spain. Different and ironic tests will take you to Villa Corrupta, where you must show how attentive you have been to the present news.

Objective:

Arrive at Villa Corrupta and correctly answer a question in each case, first going through the Basic Guide to the Corrupted and the National Attractions that consist of different types of tests where the teams must give free rein to their imagination to try to deceive the other team or fulfill other goals, depending on the test.

—description from the designer (translated)


Corruptopolis es un juego de mesa en el que comprobarás tus conocimientos y podrás aprender sobre los principales casos de corrupción política en España. Diferentes e irónicas pruebas te llevarán a Villa Corrupta, donde deberás demostrar lo atenta o atento que has estado a la actualidad.

Objetivo:

Llegar a Villa Corrupta y responder correctamente una pregunta de cada caso, pasando antes por la Guía Básica del Corrupto y los Atractivos Nacionales que constan de diferentes tipos de pruebas donde los equipos deberán dar rienda suelta a su imaginación para intentar engañar al otro equipo o conseguir otros fines, dependiendo de la prueba.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Travel Europe
boardgame.description:
The goal of each player is to get the most points possible. Players are tourists who travel by train, ship, or plane through the most famous cities in Europe. During these visits, the players take part in interesting events: cultural, sporting, musical and entertainment. They also visit many important attractions, including historical, scenic, museums, entertainment, and restaurants. In the game, it is especially worth visiting Spain, Poland, and Italy. The winner of the game is the person who creates the best trip planner by visiting interesting places and participating in interesting events.

Game releeased as a part of the project "Playing to learn, learning to play." with the support of the Erasmus+ Programme of the European Union.
Project coordination: NGO Amics

Game published as Print&Play and small amount of boxes.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex Supplement – Crimson Slaughter
boardgame.description:
Once the loyal servants of the Imperium of Mankind, now the Crimson Slaughter leave only destruction and despair in their wake. Tainted by the genocidal purging of Umidia they are plagued by the voices of their victims. Only through butchery can they silence the voices that haunt them - but the whispers of the dead always return.

Within the 72 pages of this hardback, full-colour book you will find:

The gore-splattered history of the Crimson Slaughter - a tragic tale of how a loyal Chapter was transformed into Warp-cursed, bloodthirsty renegades.
Supplemental rules for building an unstoppable army of the merciless Crimson Slaughter.
A showcase of Crimson Slaughter miniatures.
A series of narrative missions that enable you to recreate some of the Crimson Slaughters bloody battles.
Rules for unique relics, Warlord Traits and new stratagems that reflect the Crimson Slaughter's favoured tactics.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Spy Code: Diamond Heist
boardgame.description:
Bringing a new addition to the Spy Code range, this co-operative skill and action game requires communication and teamwork to win. Can you beat the impossible mission? Enter into a movie moment and manoeuvre through the board to complete different objectives. When the alarm triggers and alerts the police the race against the clock is on to escape with the diamond and win the game.

If you can recover the Diamond and escape in the Getaway Car before the Guards arrive, you win the game! If the Guards arrive before you can escape, you’ve been caught! Set up the game and try again!

boardgame.name: Myst 4: Adventure Beyond the D'ni Ultraworld
Myst IV: Adventure Beyond the D'ni Ultraworld
boardgame.description:
After having worked on the game for two years (June 1999 to June 2001), it was cancelled as the rights to the Myst franchise transferred from Mattel to Ubisoft.

According to Fortier, Ultraworld’s development was only about 20% finished, but the designs themselves were completely done. The game was presented in realtime 3D, a first for the series at that point. Some ideas from Ultraworld even managed to carry over into Myst IV: Revelation. Specfically the inclusion of Sirrus and Achenar, the two brothers from the original Myst.

Two original characters were also featuerd in Ultraworld, Kervis and Merinia. The purpose of these characters are unknown, as is most of Ultraworld’s story. A sketch showing off an “Ice Locall” age is also featured among the concept art, showing a mechnical panel controlling some sort of platform.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Supplement – Crimson Slaughter
boardgame.description:
Once the loyal servants of the Imperium of Mankind, now the Crimson Slaughter leave only destruction and despair in their wake. Tainted by the genocidal purging of Umidia they are plagued by the voices of their victims. Only through butchery can they silence the voices that haunt them - but the whispers of the dead always return.

Within the 72 pages of this hardback, full-colour book you will find:

the gore-splattered history of the Crimson Slaughter - a tragic tale of how a loyal Chapter was transformed into Warp-cursed, bloodthirsty renegades;
supplemental rules for building an unstoppable army of the merciless Crimson Slaughter.
a showcase of Crimson Slaughter miniatures;

rules for unique relics, Warlord Traits and new stratagems that reflect the Crimson Slaughter's favoured tactics;

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Supplement – Black Legion
boardgame.description:
For ten thousand years, the Black Legion has fought the armies of the false Emperor, striking out from the Eye of Terror to sow ruin and madness among the stars. In their wake, worlds burn to ash and the screams of the damned echo in the warp.

This supplement to Codex: Chaos Space Marines allows you to turn your Citadel miniatures collection into a mighty host of Black Legion, bringing fire and death to the Imperium.

Within the 72 pages of this book you will find:

the story of Black Legion's fall from grace and rise to power, including the tale of their infamous Warmaster, Abaddon the Despoiler;
a showcase of Chaos Space Marine Citadel miniatures, presenting warband colours and icons of the Black Legion;
a set of supplemental rules including Warlord Traits and Chaos Artefacts that, along with Codex: Chaos Space Marines, allow you to assemble your Black Legion models into a force for Warhammer 40,000 battles;
a series of narrative missions that enable you to play through Black Legion's bloody history, alongside a set of Altar of War missions that showcase the Black Legion's deadly tactics;
a set of Black Legion Tactical Objectives and 7 formation datasheets for Codex: Chaos Space Marines.


Black Legion is designed work alongside the rules found in Codex: Chaos Space Marines, which you will need in order to field a Black Legion collection on the tabletop.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Supplement – Traitor Legions

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Supplement – Traitor Legions
boardgame.description:
The Traitor Legions of the Chaos Space Marines have waged terrible wars of hate and vengeance upon the Imperium of Mankind for ten thousand years. From the Daemon worlds of the Eye of Terror, they plot the destruction of the empire they once helped to build. They have neither forgotten nor forgiven the loyalists, nor the False Emperor whom they serve. These warriors will not rest until the galaxy is burning, and the Emperors putrid carcass is cast down from the Golden Throne into the filth where it belongs.

Codex Supplement: Traitor Legions is a 136-page, full-colour softback supplement to Codex: Chaos Space Marines. It contains a wealth of additional content and rules that any Chaos Space Marines army can use, with a huge array of rules for all nine of the Traitor Legions.

—description from the publisher

Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Eldars
Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Kodeks – Eldarzy

boardgame.description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


The Eldar embody excellence in the arts of war. Their psychic abilities are unparalleled and their elite armies are without peer. Now seer and civilian alike battle for the survival of the great craftworlds upon which they ply the stars. Led by potent psykers and powerful lords, their armies fight fiercely against the upstart races of the galaxy, determined that their empire will blaze once more into glorious light before fate consigns them to oblivion.

This 104-page full-colour book contains:

The tragic tale of how the Eldar fell from grace, and a rich and full background on the survivors of their race.
A description of, and rules for, the specialist forces of the Eldar, the technologies they use and their special characters.
A stunning showcase of Eldar Citadel miniatures, with the various colour schemes and icons of the craftworlds.
A comprehensive army list to help you guide your Eldar collection on the battlefield.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Convoi Express
Switch & Signal
Zwrotnice & Semafory
boardgame.description:
All Aboard! — The Cooperative Train Game

You begin this cooperative, family-friendly train game by controlling just a few trains on the tracks. At first, it’s easy to make them travel where you like. As more trains arrive, you have to plan and coordinate your train schedules. Is the signal green? Where is this train going? Oh no, the switch wasn’t set! If your train heads off in the wrong direction, your goods won’t arrive on time! Only by working together to schedule and move your trains efficiently, will you and your team of conductors be able to win the game.

The two different gameboards, Central Europe and North America, each bring fun challenges to overcome. In this cooperative strategy train game work with your teammates to build a network of trains that run at different speeds to transport goods as efficiently as possible. It has simple rules that are easy to learn and allow you to jump right into the action. Switch & Signal features a double-sided game board, city tile variants, and customizable difficulty levels.

boardgame.name: Kombo Klash!
boardgame.description:
As another sun sets and the pale moon rises over the ancient proving grounds, the bravest and wiliest creatures gather for the Klash — the ultimate test of wits and ability!

Kombo Klash is a tactical tile-laying and combo-scoring game for 2-4 players. Can you master each creature's unique ability and form the craziest Kombos needed to win the game? Use the raven to summon extra tiles into your hand, score bonuses by adding wolves to the Klash, or kick other animals across the board with the kangaroo! Manipulate tiles by playing alligators and vultures, steal them back into your hand by playing hypnotic snakes, and smash through tiles by using gorillas...and don't forget the chameleons, who can do anything and everything!

The goal of Kombo Klash is to score as many points as possible by the end of the game, which occurs at the end of a round in which one or more players reaches or exceeds the predetermined target score. The player with the most points at the end of that round wins.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Crypt Hunters
boardgame.description:
Crypt Hunters is a fast-paced game of exploration and adventure for two players, set in the world of Warhammer Age of Sigmar. Orris Suresight and his Stormcast Eternals must find an ancient relic hidden amidst the twisting catacombs of the Ten Thousand Tombs, or the city of Glymmsforge will fall to the undead. Will you play the stalwart Stormcast Eternals, clad in gleaming golden armour and armed with powerful weapons, or the vengeful spirits of the Chainrasps intend on dooming Glymmsforge forever?

In each game the Chainrasp player creates the labyrinth, while the Stormcast Eternals players searches its twisting passages for the Hyshian Luminator, the ancient relic that will save Glymmsforge. The board is made up of hexagon tiles, and as the Stormcast Eternals player searches further, the labyrinth will reveal infernal traps and can divide into sections leading some Stormcast Eternals to become lost in the dungeon depths.

You’ll resolve your actions using a set of special dice, and mark status effects with tokens. Each faction also utilizes a deck of cards with powerful effects. Banish your enemies with the holy energy of Sigmar, or inflict them with supernatural terror. Every roll of the dice could swing the outcome in your favour, or doom you to ignoble defeat. To win, the Stormcast Eternal player must first find the Winch tile, and then activate the Hyshian Luminator, banishing the undead. The Chainrasp player wins if all the Stormcast Eternals are slain. Play a single game, or combine your games in a campaign, and add new challenges with a unique system of optional Burdens.

-description from publisher
