boardgame.name: Twin Princes: Reborn Edition
boardgame.description:
The players are twin princes competing for the throne of a kingdom.
Split 5 cards into 2 groups. Your opponent chooses one of them first. Then deploy them. This is an "I Split, You Choose" area control game for 2 players. Fly around by the Magic Carpet and get help from the Genie and Roc. Parents and pets can be a nuisance sometimes... Beware of the donkey! There is a bandit lurking in the bag.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex Supplement – Iyanden
boardgame.description:
For thousands upon thousands of years, the Eldar of Iyanden have sailed through the sea of stars, defending the galaxy’s eastern rim from the threat of Chaos. They have won great victories against the most horrific of foes, but have known terrible tragedy also. Yet Iyanden endures, with the souls of the departed fighting alongside the few who have survived. Together, the living and the dead must fight for their race’s survival in a galaxy riven by war.

Iyanden is a 72-page full-colour hardback supplement to Codex: Eldar. It contains 32 pages of new, rich and expanded background detailing craftworld Iyanden, along with original art, box-outs, a timeline, and iconography of Ghost Warrior houses. It features a showcase of glorious Citadel miniatures presenting the colour schemes and iconography of the Iyanden craftworld.

In addition to this it comes with warlord traits, wargear and psychic powers to help transform your Eldar collection into a mighty Iyanden warhost. You can even take a Wraith Lord or Wraithknight as your Warlord. It also includes battle scenarios - some of which you can use to relive epic battles from the Iyanden’s history - plus there are stratagems for use in your games of Cities of Death and Planetstrike.

Iyanden is designed work alongside the rules found in Codex: Eldar, which you will need in order to field an Iyanden collection on the tabletop.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Supplement – Angels of Death
boardgame.description:
The finest warriors Mankind has ever known. Space Marines stride boldly across the galaxy, taking no prisoners, roaring benedictions to the Emperor as they cleanse planets and systems of alien filth. As the enemies of Humanity rise and gather, the Space Marines will be there to meet them with bolters primed and chainswords screaming. Each Space Marine is a genetically-engineered master of combat, sworn to perform his duty to the Emperor until victory… or death.

This 128-page softback supplement is designed for any Codex: Space Marines army. Included within:

a guide to Strike Forces and Chapter organisation, including 4 Army List Entry datasheets and 14 Formations;
background and organisation on White Scars, Imperial Fists, Iron Hands, Salamanders and Raven Guard Chapters, as well as their typical Strike Forces;
rules for the Terminator Captain, Cataphractii Terminators and Contemptor Dreadnought;
Warlord Traits, Relics and Tactical Objectives;
four complete psychic disciplines available to Space Marines Librarians of all Chapters (including Blood Angels, Dark Angels, Space Wolves, Grey Knights and Deathwatch)


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Darkest Dungeon: Das Brettspiel
Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game
boardgame.description:
“Ruin has come to our family.”

In this adaptation of Red Hook’s acclaimed Darkest Dungeon video game, you strive to cleanse a manor and its surroundings of all manner of evil: hordes of the undead, foul beasts and eldritch abominations... And, finally, either at death’s door or at your wit’s end, you will have to uproot evil itself from the darkest dungeon.

Darkest Dungeon is a fully cooperative dungeon crawl game in which players take on the role of adventurers. Although brave and determined, adventurers are only human! They are prone to the madness and pain the twisted dwellers of the dungeons will inflict upon them. Death can occur, but is not the worst fate: heroes can be driven mad and beyond help!

The game is played in campaigns of 11 missions. To reach the Darkest Dungeon itself, players will undertake 3 missions per threat level and vanquish the boss. Then, they will be strong enough and face the horrors of the Darkest Dungeon! They may emerge victorious... if they dispatch the source of evil that plagues the land.

For each hero, select 3 skills out of 7 before heading into your mission (and level the heroes up to gain access to more skills). In each room, pick the most suitable stance to best resolve the conflict! Then, on each turn, a player chooses two of the available actions of moving, interacting with the environment, changing their stance or using a skill (if eligible for their current stance). Triumph over encounters, resist rampant madness and emerge victorious before throwing yourself into another battle. Between missions, spend your time in the hamlet, visiting various buildings to find relief from the physical and mental trauma you’ve just endured. Restore the hamlet to its former glory and it will reward you and help you to fulfill the ultimate goal.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Supplement – Waaagh! Ghazghkull
boardgame.description:
Waaagh! Ghazghkull is a supplement for Codex: Orks which expands upon the campaigns of the mighty Ork Warlord – Ghazghkull Mag Uruk Thraka.

This 80 page tome holds the details of the savage splendour of the most famous Ork invasion force to ever take over a planet. From the strange tale of how Ghazghkull took his first fateful steps towards his unlikely destiny as ultimate overlord of the largest Waaagh! in the galaxy, to the rules that allow you to arrange your collection of Citadel Miniatures into Formations and Detachments from Ghazghkull’s army.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Supplement – Champions of Fenris
boardgame.description:
The Great Company of Logan Grimnar is comprised of the greatest heroes in the Space Wolves Chapter. Their sagas are replete with glorious deeds, they are the sworn battle-brothers of the Great Wolf himself and true Sons of Russ.

This 80 page tome holds the glorious history of Logan Grimnar, his legendary deeds and rise to command of one of the Imperium’s most powerful Space Marine Chapters. Furthermore, in these pages you will hear of his Wolf Guard – the heroes who have fought by the Great Wolf’s side and the many battles they have won in his name.

If that’s not enough, this volume is packed with pictures of fantastically painted Space Wolves miniatures and datasheets. There are also new Warlord Traits and missions that allow you to recreate some of the most important battles of the Champions of Fenris and to employ Logan Grimnar’s favoured tactics.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Le nez du vin
boardgame.description:
An olfactory game in which you must recognize wine aromas.

This is a board and 5 tokens to play with the 54 aroma masterkit from Le Nez du vin (sold separately): 54 small bottles that smell different aromas you can find in wine (lemon, leather, roasted almond, smoky note...).

Two game modes : On one side of the board, a Game of Goose-like to discover the aromatic families ; on the other side, more expert players must associate aromas with terroirs (type of land where the grape grows).

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Supplement – Farsight Enclaves
boardgame.description:
The Tau are a new force in the galaxy, optimistic and bright. Yet even they have their dark secrets. When the Warrior hero Farsight conquered the worlds of the Damocles Gulf, he learned forbidden truths that would divide the Tau Empire forever.

This revised and updated supplement to Codex: Tau Empire allows you to tailor your collection of Tau miniatures into a force from the Farsight Enclaves, armed to the teeth and ready for battle.

Included in this 80-page softback book:

A comprehensive account of the rise of Commander Farsight, his defection from the Tau Empire and the establishment of the Farsight Enclaves;
Several formations from Kauyon and Mont’ka, along with Farsight Enclaves Tactical Objectives, Warlord Traits and Signature Systems;
Three Farsight Enclaves Altar of War missions;
Updated photography and uniform guides.


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex Supplement – Farsight Enclaves

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex Supplement – Farsight Enclaves
boardgame.description:
The Tau are a new force in the galaxy, optimistic and bright. Yet even they have their dark secrets. When the Warrior hero Farsight conquered the worlds of the Damocles Gulf, he learned forbidden truths that would divide the Tau Empire forever.
This supplement to Codex: Tau Empire allows you to tailor your collection of Tau miniatures into a force from the Farsight Enclaves, armed to the teeth and ready for battle.

Within the 72 pages of this softback book you will find:

The history of the Farsight Enclaves, from O'Shovah's first conflicts to the brink of their destruction
A showcase of beautifully painted miniatures , presenting the colours and insignia of those under Farsight's command
New missions that recreate Farsight's most famous battles, as well as additional rules to customise your games of Cities of Death and Planetstrike
A series of narrative missions that enable you to play through O'Shovah's military career, alongside a set of Altar of war missions that showcase the Farsight Enclaves' favoured fighting styles


Farsight Enclaves: A Codex: Tau Empire Supplement is designed to work alongside the rules found in Codex: Tau Empire, which you will need in order to field a Farsight collection on the tabletop.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Alien Astronauts
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

While we all know that wizards of our world plumb the depths of the astral planes, some of us forget that they are not alone. Other worlds have their explorers too, sending them out to gather knowledge of what may be familiar to us, but is strange to them. The alien astronaut is one such explorer, a visitor to this world from a place unknown to us, so far away it is. They bring devices with them to help them survive and gather data. For what purpose though? Their own, of course.

boardgame.name: Hexpedition: Jaws of the King
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Far beyond the horizon, a hundred leagues from any other civilization, lies a remote archipelago – tropical islands overrun with ancient beasts, advanced tribes, and a king’s ransom in lost treasure. Many venture to the isles known as the Jaws of the King, but few return. Will you become lost like so many before, or will you witness unspeakable marvels and live to tell the tale?

Hexpedition: Jaws of the King is a hexcrawl and adventure seed generator set on a tropical archipelago. It includes:

A blank map for players
A numbered hex map for the game master
Over 100 Hexes each with a brief description of what can be found in that area
A history of the islands and the Terrors that once plagued the islands
Description of the people and tribes that inhabit the archipelago,
Creatures and items unique to the region
Roll tables for encounters, treasure, shipwrecks and more.
Hints and advice on running adventures
A systemless addition to any fantasy or pulp based TTRPG


Hexpedition: Jaws of the King is a lush adventure seed generator and hexmap, with a focus on exploration and the wonder of discovering a distant civilization.

boardgame.name: No Job For Amateurs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an adventure for Cepheus Engine.

The travelers are summoned to the estate of Colbix Davian. Davian is a rich merchant from the planet Chedusre. His wife has been abducted and he is seeking an elite force of mercenaries to get her back safely. She is being held at a fortress on a desert world nearby by a notorious pirate and criminal. Sounds easy doesn't it?

boardgame.name: Spell Variants & Exotic Components: Level VI
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A useful handbook containing level 6 spell's variants and new components to empower each spell.

Ampoule of Gorgon’s breath
Amulet of the Planes

boardgame.name: The Eyes Have It
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An MP has been murdered, and the crew must investigate. This brings involves them in secretive matters of great political importance, in both the mundane world and Hidden World.

Join us in this 12 page London-based adventure for the Liminal RPG, where the magical and mundane worlds collide in the modern day United Kingdom.

The Worshipful Company of Investigators or the player character crew – London’s premier collection of Hidden World problem solvers – are asked to investigate a matter of the highest delicacy. An MP has been found dead, with his eyes cleanly removed and replaced by something …wrong!

This adventure is a sequel to ‘One Boggart’s Rubbish’ and uses some elements of the Pax Londinium sourcebook but it can be played independently without any changes.

boardgame.name: The Secrets of Cogstone
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for five characters of levels 9-11

The gnomish tinkerers of Cogstone were once known across the vale for their amazing inventions. Cogstone airships drifted among the clouds and their creations sold in every major city. Centuries have passed and no one knows what happened to the gnomes. They simply vanished.

Soon people began to fear what the gnomes might have created in their secretive laboratories. Now only treasure seekers and adventurers dare to enter Cogstone, and most never return.

boardgame.name: Thin Ice
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four characters of level 9

The night was wild. A great cracking sound echoed from the peaks. And when the dawn came, the landscape had changed.

The great glacier Botasvjökull had come down the mountainside, breaking wide open and laying bare its heart for all to see. Now every frost mage and ice witch from here to the Northern Reach is vying for a piece of the deep ice. For there is power in the glacier’s frozen core, and only the strongest may claim it for their own.

boardgame.name: The Hidden Necropolis
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Miners at a copper mine in the foothills of a large mountain range have discovered the remains of an ancient civilization and something more mysterious. A lone survivor of the mine arrives at the nearby town, but is delirious from his experience. Will the adventurers sent to unravel the mystery find out what dark fate has befallen the mine?

The Hidden Necropolis is an adventure written for Five Torches Deep for 4-6 PCs of levels 3-5. The adventure is also compatible with 5E, including 5E stat blocks for all monsters and other mechanics specific to 5E.

The adventure features over 20 FTD stat blocks (including some standard low-level monsters like goblins, ogres, and bugbears), a minor magic mishap table, an expanded injury table, and an expanded sundries list.

The adventure will take 1-2 sessions to complete (depending on how much your players like to explore). The Hidden Necropolis is an old-shool style adventure based on dungeon exploration.

boardgame.name: Veil of Truth: Campaign Primer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In 2083, Humankind stumbled upon the truth: we are not alone.

Worse: we were just another primitive species in a Galaxy much wider and complex than we could ever imagine.

Veil of Truth - Campaign Primer is a FREE ebook that presents you with the universe of Veil of Truth, originally released as a Pathfinder compatible products back in 2012, part of an expanding transmedia series with novels, short stories and video games.

Inside you will find:

The story of the Veil of Truth universe and its main factions and regions;
3 alternate Mystic Connections: Biomancer, Kineticist and Metabolicist;
New Technomancer options to make a medtech: a nanotechnology healer;
A new Soldier Fighting Style: The Psychic Warrior;
Ideas on how to adapt monsters and items to a space opera setting;
And an introductory adventure in search of a fabled space station left behind by one of the Fallen Empires!

Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Chaos Dämonen
Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Demoni del Caos

Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Démons du Chaos
Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): コデックス – ケイオスディーモン
boardgame.description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

boardgame.name: TAKUMPET!
boardgame.description:
“Find those who hide by looking for two of the same hiding spot in the play area OR guess where they’re hiding.

If you’re hiding, don’t get caught!”

Takumpet! Card Game is hide-and-seek translated into a light memory game using a deck of 18 cards. Choose one player who’s going to be the seeker, and give one card for the rest as their hiding spot.

Once per round, players attempts to find two of the same hiding spot and claim it as points. instead of flipping cards, The seeker has the option to guess where the rest are hiding.

—description form the publisher

boardgame.name: Gatefall: Kickstarter Exclusives
boardgame.description:
This is a set of items for Gatefall that were only available during the Kickstarter campaign.

Backers received TWO EXCLUSIVE FIGURES with their orders: Seline the sorcereress for the Fantasy team, and Piggy for the Wasteland team.

The box countains 2 new characters, Piggy and Seline. they can be used instead of or in conjonction with the ones found in the original game. Each new character come with their own stats and abilities.

The box also contains the "ghost" module, they come into play when using the Seline character.
"Ghost are allies. Once per turn, Seline can take a move action to move all ghosts individually 1 space. Or take an attack action to have each ghost cause one point of damage to every enemy it is adjacent to."

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Tiránidos
Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Tyraniden
Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Tyranides
Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Tyranidi
Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Tyranids
Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Kodeks – Tyranidzi
Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): コデックス – テイラニツド
boardgame.description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

boardgame.name: Mimürfel
boardgame.description:
Mimürfel is a game collection with special six-sided dice. Each page shows a face in a different mood: the beaming man, the optimist, the undecided, the astonished, the angry, the pessimist. The game contains 12 of these wooden dice. There are 4 children's games and 12 other games. The rules are compiled in a small rulebook. Everything is packed in a tube.
In the children's games, the main aim is to pantomime the diced mood. The other games are mainly about role-playing games or games in which stories about thought-out topics are to be presented to match the moods chosen. So they are quite communicative games.

—user summary

listing.notes:

Shipping costs see informations below.
Payment via PayPal or bank transfer. If you pay via PayPal, please use the button “Send to friends abroad”, then there are no fees. ... Thanks!!
Please verify your shipping address before ordering or paying with PayPal. If your address contains non-Latin characters please include it in Latin script, too.

boardgame.name: Weird North
boardgame.description:
WEIRD NORTH is a role-playing game for one referee and a handful of players. Players take control of wandering sellswords and adventurers, exploring a huge and curious world in order to claim great wealth, expand their renown, and achieve personal goals.

What This Is
- An RPG is a conversational game where everyone at the table plays in a shared world of imagination.
- This game centers on questions, creativity, and nuance, all of which form an emergent story.
- Player characters are empowered, but vulnerable. The world is huge, and filled with places to explore.

Who You Are
- The referee is a neutral arbiter of the world, presenting information and circumstances clearly.
- The players take the world at face value, treating it as real, consistent, and full of both risk and reward.
- Together, you trust each other to engage with a shared setting, objectives, and consequences.

Sword & Sorcery
- The universe is decadent, mostly dead, and without vested interest in cosmic good and redemption.
- Any given world is rent apart by ancient machinery, fell magicks, and intervening godlings.
- Humankind bands together to manage a living, but tensions are high and threats are everywhere.

Picaresque Adventure
- You play as and compete with daring scoundrels, out for treasure, power, and reputation.
- Opportunities abound for high-stakes expedition. Your context is dangerous, but you have grit.
- Fair fights are bad odds. You need to negotiate, plot, haggle, ally, and deceive to survive.

Inspiration
- Howard's Cimmeria, where Conan slogged against petty rulers and snakepeople for profit and renown.
- Vance's Dying Earth, where Cugel crossed through portals to far sanctums while his own world rotted.
- Lieber's Lankhmar, where Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser fleeced nobles with bounties on their own heads.

Thanks goes to Chris McDowall for creating Into the Odd and Electric Bastionland, David Black for The Black Hack 2nd Edition, the Bastionland Discord for remarkable ideas and feedback, the yawning sea of pulp fantasy and science fiction authors of the 19th and 20th centuries for their communal wellspring of weird tales, and my young son who daily pores over Astonishing Swordsmen & Sorcerers of Hyperborea.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Supplement – Haemonculus Covens
boardgame.description:
Inside this 80 page supplement you will find the sinister history of the Haemonculi of the undercity, revealing their gruesome deeds within Commorragh and on the battlefields of the wider galaxy. There are additional rules that work alongside Codex: Dark Eldar from which you can create a sinister Covenite warhost to unleash in your games of Warhammer 40,000. Plus a showcase of beautifully painted Citadel miniatures that depict the menacing colour schemes and iconography of the Covens. Finally, this book includes new missions, allowing you to recreate some of the most important of the Haemonculi’s realspace raids and employ the favoured tactics of the Coven lords.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: FlexAI Guidebook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

FlexAI is an attempt to model and simulate monster and NPC behavior in combat and social encounters. It scales in complexity from very simple to as complex as you as a GM would like it to be. It can be used in any tabletop roleplaying game with zero preparation time.

The system takes only a few minutes to learn, is easy and quick to use, and can enhance any tabletop roleplaying combat experience.

This massive resource contains hundreds of detailed scenarios to generate dynamic, contextually-appropriate creature behavior in various combat circumstances.

Over 860 tables, tens of thousands of combinations and permutations, and yet all it takes is a few minutes and a roll of a d100 to imbue you adventures with intelligence and fascination!

boardgame.name: Shadows of Decay
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cosmic entities have always been part of the world, actually they are responsible for the existence of the world as a whole, spreading chaos and insanity into the corrupted minds. When one of three kingdoms decide to use this special cosmic connection to gain power advantage, they accidentally throw the entire world into a slow and inevitable apocalypse. Can the two other kingdoms with their armies stop the shadows of decay? Or perhaps only a
very special group of heroes can do it.

Shadow of Decay is a short scenario written to be playing using Fate Core Rulebook by Evil Hats Productions. It is a low magic medieval setting with huge influence of cosmic horror stories, where the players will not only be fighting physical beings but also their own corrupted minds.

boardgame.name: Panda-Monium
boardgame.description:
All over the world — from the Arctic to the Amazon to Australia— animals are under threat. Panda-Monium is an educational board game where you learn about the climate crisis — and save endangered animals.

Panda-Monium is a fun game with a serious message. It's quick and easy to learn, quick and easy to play and hard to put back in the box!

Each player has a pack of 20 endangered animal cards which they must play onto the board before the climate crisis takes over. As the carbon cards are placed on the board the global temperature increases.

It’s a race against time to save the endangered animals.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Astra Militarum
boardgame.description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Militarium Tempestus
boardgame.description:
The Ordo Tempestus commands the finest human soldiers in the galaxy. It’s disciplined ranks boast not only the elite Scions of the Militarum Tempestus but also brutal Commissars.

Within the 72 pages of this hardback, full-colour book you will find:

A definitive guide to the Militarum Tempestus, including the structures of the Officio Prefectus and a record of many of the legendary deeds enacted by this brotherhood of warriors.
The story of how Scions and Commissars are trained by the Schola Progenium to best the best human warriors.
A stunning showcase of the Ordo Tempestus Citadel miniatures, presenting the uniforms, regimental names and insignias of the Imperium’s elite.
A full description of each unit, the rules for its use, and an army list that enables you to organise and collect an army worthy of the most discerning Lord Commissar.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Caballeros Imperiales
Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Cavalieri Imperiali
Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Chevaliers Impériaux
Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Imperial Knights
Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Imperialen Ritter
Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Kodeks – Imperialni Rycerze
Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): コデックス – インペリアルナイ
boardgame.description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

boardgame.name: Oldegrave: Old School Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A pre-Deluxe Rulebook release of the Oldegrave game, powered by the Shift7 Game System.

The Old School Edition of Oldegrave has only 4 standard Ancestries (Dwarf, Elf, Halfling & Human) and only 4 standard Archetypes (Cleric, Mage, Thief and Warrior). It also uses the 6 Attribute scores (STR, DEX, etc) of the worlds oldest roleplaying game. It also does not have Druid or Illusionist spells. Besides the above things the rules and rulebook are mostly identical in text to what appears in the upcoming full color rulebook.

boardgame.name: Oldegrave: A Classic Fantasy Adventure Game
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A classic fantasy adventure game in the style of the earlier days of the worlds oldest roleplaying game. Although it mimics that style it is built upon the modern mechanics of the Shift7 Game System, a player facing system, where the players make all of the rolls. The Shift7 system uses a small dice pool of 2 to 3 dice (1d20 + Attribute die and maybe plus or minus a single d6) with no static modifiers (no more +1's or -1's), this speeds up play and provides a cohesive system that allows both GM and Players to easily come up with solutions for any attempted action.

Oldegrave is highly compatible with OSR adventures, and with minimal conversion you can easily adapt and use any classic adventure modules you own. If monsters have a size and HD you are ready to go.

Gather your friends and relive the good old days!

boardgame.name: Gott würfelt nicht
boardgame.description:
A compilation of several games stored in a ring binder, edited as part of a small edition for the exhibition "Gott würfelt nicht" in Göttingen 2005, initialized by Reinhold Wittig, Althöfer and other game designers and published by Reinhold Wittig.

The ring binder contains several games ready to play and print 'n' play games. There is an introduction by several designers and scientists about different aspects of specific games, games compared to art and culture, mathematic problems and more.
The first 10 copies of this catalogue are numbered and contain 2 more games and have 3 boards made of leather instead of paper and artificial leather.

2 puzzles are included as well (not listed, because they don't fit as games for BGG)

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex Supplement – Clan Raukaan
boardgame.description:
This supplement to Codex: Space Marines allows you to create the unstoppable army of merciless Iron Hands from the 3rd Company, Clan Raukaan.

Within the 72 pages of this hardback, full colour book you will find:

The History of Clan Raukaan: it details their victories, their defeats, and the constant battle they have fought against the terrible flaw lurking deep within the psyche of their Chapter.
A showcase of Space Marine miniatures featuring the colour scheme and iconography of Clan Company Raukaan.
New missions: both to recreate famous battles and to reflect the Clan Company Raukaan’s favoured tactics.
Unique relics, Warlord Traits and new stratagems – Perfect for games of Planetstrike and Cities of Death.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex Supplement – Sentinels of Terra
boardgame.description:
For the defenders of Terra, the Great Crusade never ended. They fight to reclaim what has been lost and will not rest until the worlds of Mankind are united once more.

This supplement to Codex: Space Marines allows you to build the unstoppable army of the Sentinels of Terra; the Imperial Fists 3rd Company.
Within the 72 pages of this hardback, full colour book you will find:

The History of the Sentinels of Terra, and their struggles to reclaim honours and glories under the command of Captain Darnath Lysander.
A showcase of Space Marine miniatures featuring the colour scheme and iconography of the Sentinels of Terra.
New missions: both to recreate famous battles and to reflect the Sentinels of Terra’s favoured tactics.
Unique relics, Warlord Traits and new stratagems – Perfect for games of Planetstrike and Cities of Death.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Monopoly: RCSC
Monopoly: Royal Charleroi Sporting Club
boardgame.description:
A Monopoly about the Sporting de Charleroi, created in 1904.
Features 22 of the club legendary players.


Fondé en 1904, le Sporting de Charleroi s’est forgé un nom au sein de l’élite du football belge. Au fil des décennies, le Matricule 22 a vécu de nombreuses épopées fastes mais aussi traversé des périodes plus délicates: Vice-champions nationaux en 1969, finalistes de la Coupe de Belgique en 1978 et 1993, les Zèbres ont par ailleurs connu les joies des rencontres européennes en 1994 et 2015. L’année 2012 a marqué un tournant dans l’histoire récente du club. Un changement de direction allait insuffler une nouvelle dynamique portée par un novateur plan stratégique 3-6-9 avec, in fine, des ambitions sportives revues à la hausse concrétisées par une qualification pour les play-offs 1 ( top 6) mais aussi pour les tours préliminaires de l’Europa League. Le Sporting est redevenu respecté et crédible sur la scène nationale, capable de se mêler chaque année à la lutte pour les premières places du championnat. Ce jeu est dédié à Jean-Noël Antoine, lui qui avait gardé son âme de gamin et qui était si fier de son club!

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: België – Land van het Bier
Trivial Pursuit: Belgique – Pays de la Bière
boardgame.description:
1800 questions about Belgian Beers.

Categories:

Geography
Types of Beer
History
Culture & Gastronomy
Manufacturing
Surprise

boardgame.name: Takkure: A Cyberpunk Rugby Game
boardgame.description:
In a violent cyberpunk universe, players take on the role of coaches to lead teams of 4 players with the goal of becoming the best team in the Neon League.
A 1vs1 board game that simulates the rules of rugby. Tackles, blows, players on the ground, injuries and all kinds of situations that make takkure a fast-paced and fun game.

Immerse yourself in this universe and play for victory!

How to play:
Takkure is a metal miniature game based on the rules of rugby. Players must land the ball in the opposing try zone to score a point. For this, they can only pass the ball to a player behind them, and the defense can only tackle the ball carrier.
The game board measures 46x68cm, it has no squares. Twelve-sided dice are used and the coaches have a deck with spectacular plays.
A purely sporty, fast and spectacular game.

listing.notes:
Just arrived, but too many games.
Metal Miniatures
KS Edition
You play the same price as in the KS (incl. Tax, shipping)

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Wavre
boardgame.description:
The city of Wavre has had its Monopoly since 2010.

The game takes up the streets, heritage, culture and folklore of the city.

Only 1000 copies were published.


Située au cœur du Brabant Wallon, à quelques minutes de la capitale, Wavre se découvre au creux de deux collines, nichée dans la vallée de la Dyle. Fière de son « Maca », une statue d’un jeune garçon qui escalade le muret de l’hôtel de ville, elle l’est aussi de son sens de l’hospitalité et de son centre pittoresque avec ses charmantes rues et ruelles piétonnes qui invitent à la flânerie. Chef-lieu de la province du Brabant wallon, Wavre est aussi reconnue pour son patrimoine, sa culture et son folklore avec sa délicieuse tarte au Stofé, ses géants, le carillon de l’église Saint-Jean-Baptiste ou encore le jeu de Jean et Alice pour n’en citer que quelques-uns.

Enrichie par de nombreux commerces de proximité et animée au quotidien par ses citoyens, Wavre regorge de vie et revendique cet esprit frondeur qui lui va si bien.

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Serpent Kings (Oldegrave)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I loved this adventure and have used it for games ranging from Castles and Crusades to even Savage Worlds. It was a no brainer for me to adapt this to the Oldegrave RPG.

Skerples wrote a fantastic introductory adventure module with old school flair and I am happy to bring it to the Oldegrave game.

I kept most all of it intact, besides adapting statistics to Oldegrave, adding the color version VTT map and adding artwork that reflects the Oldegrave game." -D.S. Myers

TotSK is an introductory adventure to not only the OSR style of play put the Oldegrave game, notes were added throughout to explain the Oldegrave rules to new GMs and players.

boardgame.name: Sword Chronicle - Feudal Fantasy Roleplaying
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In a roleplaying game, anything is possible. Your character can explore the world, take part in convoluted intrigues, wage war against rival houses, and do just about anything else you can come up with. But every roleplaying game has particular concerns. Some emphasize action—others, building complex emotional bonds between characters.

Sword Chronicle is a roleplaying game, with an unlimited field for story development. It all comes down to the protagonists: main characters played by you and your friends. But they’re not alone, because Sword Chronicle has a special focus: representing a noble house, and navigating the violent, treacherous politics of a feudal fantasy world.

If you’re new to fantasy roleplaying games, reading further will provide a rough overview, but Wikipedia, videos, and numerous other online sources can give you a complete breakdown of how to play tabletop (as opposed to electronic) fantasy roleplaying games. If you know how to play them already, proceed to the very next section.

Publisher's blurb:

A Game of War and Intrigue

You’re no adventurer. You may have shaken blood off your sword after plunging it into an unholy beast, but the real monsters stalk the world’s thrones. You may have studied the unspeakable secrets of magic, but affairs of state have secrets that are no less horrifying, for they can turn a nation into a million-limbed juggernaut of war.

You belong to a noble house, and its fortunes rise and fall with your actions. You’re a lord, a knight, a servant in the shadows, or perhaps a sorcerer-sage, bound to a dynasty of rulers. A vassal’s honor binds you to obey those above your station, and the responsibilities of privilege make you well aware that your lessers prosper or suffer according to your will—or if you fail, in spite of it. Your people are yours to protect, but the world is yours to conquer. You’ve committed your house to the Sword Chronicle.

Sword Chronicle is fantasy roleplaying in Green Ronin’s Chronicle System, now customized for you to bring in your own worlds of intrigue-laden fantasy. Within this book you’ll find the following:


A classless gritty fantasy roleplaying game, where words can be as powerful as weapons—and weapons enforce your words.
Character creation that gives the heroes specific positions in a noble house of their own design.
Rules for the fantasy ancestries of elves, dwarves, and ogres, and frictionless game systems for playing a character of multiple ancestries.
Grim, dramatic combat where death is a risk, but profit comes from ransoming your noble enemies.
Revised and reorganized intrigue rules for the Chronicle System, to give socially oriented characters real power.
Mass combat rules fit for sieges and conquests.
Subtle, powerful magic for the Chronicle System.
Introducing the Shattered Era setting.

boardgame.name: SURVIVE THIS!! Fantasy Core Rules
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

SURVIVE THIS!! is a game system created by Eric Bloat using the Open Gaming License. Created for SURVIVE THIS!! Zombies!, a zombie apocalypse horror RPG, and then overhauled for SURVIVE THIS!! Zombies! 2nd Edition. SURVIVE THIS!! was then utilized for a 1980s setting in Dark Places & Demogorgons and a street-level superhero setting in Vigilante City. SURVIVE THIS!! Fantasy is the fourth iteration of the game line bringing the rules to a traditional fantasy setting while remaining fully compatible with the previous games in the line.

System Details:

Hit Points, Mending Wounds and Death

Savings Throws: Each Character has 6 Saving Throws: COURAGE, CRITICAL, DEATH, MAGIC, MENTAL, & POISON.

Alignment: Righteous, Law, Neutral, Anarchist & Evil

29 Professions, 14 Playable Races & 19 Classes, Race and Class are Separate

Skills – 38 broad skills

XP earned five different ways: Session Survival, Encounter XP, Exceptional Roleplaying, Discretionary, and Hero XP.

Leveling Up: Go from level 1 to level 10

An extensive list of Equipment

boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

SURVIVE THIS!! is a game system created by Eric Bloat using the Open Gaming License. Created for SURVIVE THIS!! Zombies!, a zombie apocalypse horror RPG, and then overhauled for SURVIVE THIS!! Zombies! 2nd Edition. SURVIVE THIS!! was then utilized for a 1980s setting in Dark Places & Demogorgons and a street-level superhero setting in Vigilante City. SURVIVE THIS!! boardgame.name: Adventure Games: Die Akte Gloom City
Adventure Games: The Gloom City File
boardgame.description:
A message tears you away from your bleak, ho-hum existence: three people have been kidnapped! Who is behind this and why is the perpetrator pulling you of all people, four suspended cops, into the matter? Time is of the essence and so you go to the abandoned asylum to start the investigation together. Will you be able to free the hostages and catch the perp? How the thriller ends is entirely up to you! Similar to a PC adventure game, players explore locations, combine items, find clues, talk to people, and make the right choices to win the game. A cooperative board game with simple rules played in three chapters for players 16 years and up. Completely unplugged; does not require use of technology Approximately 5 hours of playtime

Explore places, combine items, and experience stories in Adventure Games, a series of co-operative games from German publisher KOSMOS. In each of these titles, players are presented with a mysterious story that they must unravel over the course of play. Working together, players explore common areas, talk to people, look for clues, and combine various items to reveal the secret of the story. Depending on what decisions the players make, the course of history changes, and there is no going back!

Unlike the co-operative EXIT: The Game series, titles in this series focus on the telling and discovery of the story with no time pressure. That said, many different paths can be experienced during play, with more than one correct resolution to the story waiting to be discovered. Each title consists of three chapters, each taking about 75 minutes to play. Nothing is destroyed, so the games can be played multiple times.

boardgame.name: Exemplar Role
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Creating a Savage Worlds characters can be a daunting task for both new and veteran players. Players often look for guidance on creating a character with a specific function in their party.
This supplement introduces two concepts to facilitate that need: Role and Class. A Role provides instructions on how to build a character to fulfill a broad function on the battlefield. If you are looking for further specialization, a Class builds upon the foundation of a Role. Classes provide a more specific vision of how a character performs their chosen function.

This supplement introduces the Exemplar Role and the subsequent Warlord and Oracle Classes. The Exemplar excels at inspiring, buffing, and supporting their party. An Exemplar may not independently dominate combat, but they ensure their allies can take on any challenge. If you enjoy playing a character who makes the party better than the sum of its parts, the Exemplar is for you. Although they have a fantasy setting feel, they can easily be adapted for use in other settings.

Includes:

25+ new Edges
1 Role
2 Classes
Advice on how to build a character for all included Roles & Classes

boardgame.name: Cards Against Humanity: Family Edition
boardgame.description:
Cards Against Humanity: Family Edition is a new party game that’s just like Cards Against Humanity, except it’s written for kids and adults to play together. Each round, one player asks a question from a black card, and everyone else answers with their funniest white card.

We didn’t just take the adult stuff out of the original game: we wrote a whole new game from scratch and tested it with thousands of families. If you like to laugh at stuff like “filling my butt with spaghetti,” this is the game for you. If you don’t, go fill your butt with spaghetti!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pirates Beyond Time!: Assault on the Mithral Fortress (ICONS)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Assault on the Mithral Fortress Continues the adventure that began in Pirates Beyond Time!

The heroes must once again contend with the time-travelling crimes of Captain Aetherblade.

boardgame.name: The Potter's Apprentice
boardgame.description:
A master potter is seeking to train an apprentice to take over their studio! You must prove yourself worthy of the position by showing your dedication for learning the craft. Manage your time and resources effectively, and gain as much experience behind the Potter's Wheel as you can before the master potter must pick their disciple.

The Potter's Apprentice is a strategic Euro game of hand and resource management. The game's circular board surrounds a rotating "Potter's Wheel," which players will interact with as they move their apprentice around the board. The core gameplay consists of the players utilizing their Action Cards in 1 of 2 ways:

- Playing on the main board to take a location's various actions or
- Adding to their player board to permanently increase 1 of their skills

As the players collect different clays, tools and water, they will make ("throw") pottery! They may need assistance from the Master Potter who moves around the board too. However, with each piece made the player will gain Experience and gradually unlock the ability to work on more pieces without supervision.

Victory Points will be earned for completed assignments, pottery, and various other scoring objectives acquired throughout the game. The player with the most VP at the end of the game is chosen as the potter's apprentice!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Andor: Les Légendes Oubliées "Âges sombres"
De Legenden van Andor: De Verloren Legenden – Donkere Tijden
Die Legenden von Andor: Die verschollenen Legenden "Düstere Zeiten"
boardgame.description:
After defeating the dragon, new and exciting adventures await the heroes of Andor. With the help of the people from the west, they rebuild the burned down farms. They encounter Arbaks, the Andorian spirits of the forest. They soon face powerful, previously unknown enemies: an ice demon, an ancient earth spirit and the chief of the Skrale. And finally, the heroes in the interior of the Gray Mountains reveal a long-kept secret.

Die Legenden von Andor: Die verschollenen Legenden "Düstere Zeiten" contains three new legends for the heroes of Andor. The first legend begins on the Cavern mine map, and the players are already part of what could mark a turning point in Andor's history...
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Die Legenden von Andor: Düstere Zeiten – Zwei junge Bewahrer

listing.notes: Game weight: 0.660 kg
Title: Andor: De Verloren Legenden: Donkere Tijden Uitbreiding Publisher: 999 Games Language(s): Dutch

boardgame.name: EXIT: Das Spiel – Das Tor zwischen den Welten
EXIT: De Poort tussen de Werelden
Exit: Il Portale tra i Mondi
Exit: The Game – The Gate Between Worlds
boardgame.description:
You have followed an ancient map to a hidden cave which purportedly contains some kind of mysterious gate. Inside the cave, you find a large metal circle made of concentric rings embedded in the rock wall. You approach the gate hesitantly and touch it. To your astonishment, the metal rings can be rotated. Suddenly, everything goes dark around you. When you regain consciousness some time later, you are no longer in the cave, but in a bizarre new world. Where are you? And how are you supposed to find your way back to the world you know? Only by working together as a team, solving riddles as you travel from world to world, will you be able to make it home safely.

Difficulty level: 3 of 5

Exit: The Game – The Gate Between Worlds is a puzzle game modeled after escape rooms, and it includes components meant to be folded, written upon, or torn, so it's marketed as a single-use game.

boardgame.name: Relay Point Alpha
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A network of satellites orbit a dying world, relaying vital telemetry between Tectonic Monitoring Stations on the planet's surface. For some reason several of the satellites have stopped transmitting. It is imperative that the link between them be restored as soon as possible to prevent massive tectonic fractures.

Relay Point Alpha is a point crawl where a Crew [group of players aka Party] has been hired to or tasked with trekking from satellite to satellite to restore communication between at least two other adjacent satellites. To play you’ll need a handful of d10’s, this sheet, and a TTRPG of your choice.

boardgame.name: Primeval
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

PRIMEVAL is is an adventure module for the Mothership sci-fi horror RPG set on the jungle moon of Ur in the distant Eridani solar system. Players have been gathered to find out why 'The Company' has been able to reach their contacts at the Shen Kuo Research Facility. They'll trek through the dangerous underbrush of Ur's megaflora, discover weird fauna, and encounter survivors of the aftermath of whatever horror occurred on Ur.

The 52-page Primeval Adventure Module PDF (Single Pages and Spreads) includes...

Campaign Integration tools
A short hex-crawl through a dangerous jungle
A facility-crawl through the Shen Kuo Research Facility
A handful of NPC's
10+ new megaflora and fauna
10+ new items
Creature Generation tables


Also included are supplemental resources:

Warden Maps
Player-facing maps and handout
boardgame.rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

boardgame.name: Sprint
boardgame.description:
The folding plastic board resembles a small dragstrip with two racecars on string and two large areas filled with keyholes. Players take turns spinning the steering-wheel spinner and then match the symbol to one of the available keyholes. Players then take one of their plastic flag markers and pull the string of their care to the corresponding hole, thus pulling their car forward.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Lottery
boardgame.description:
A Bingo-like lottery game where set numbers 1-6 on the letters of their LOTTERY strip. Then the caller pulls cards pairing letters and numbers together. The first player to have the correct numbers called for each of the corresponding letters of their LOTTERY wins the round and gets a chance to spin the jackpot wheel to see what prize they win. The player with the most money after a set number of rounds wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Camptown Racetrack
boardgame.description:
A recreation of classic simple tabletop horse racing. Horses are numbered 1 through 6, and each have a corresponding space on the spinner that allows them to move a space that turn. First horse to cross the finish line wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Putter Pool
boardgame.description:
Putter Pool A portable foldable golf mat with 6 cups a-la billiards. Now you can practice your putting while playing 9 ball, 8 ball, and more.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Doctor Dolittle
boardgame.description: A children's memory-style game of matching the front and back halves of the animals from Doctor Doolittle. Use the special action cards wisely to complete your animals first without giving your opponent any of your cards.

boardgame.name: Ghost of Tsushima - Legends
Ghost of Tsushima Legends
boardgame.description:
Legends is an entirely new experience — it’s a separate mode that doesn’t follow Jin or the companions from his journey, but instead focuses on four warriors who have been built up as legends in stories told by the people of Tsushima. Ghost of Tsushima’s single-player campaign focuses on an open world and exploring the natural beauty of the island, but Legends is haunting and fantastical, with locations and enemies inspired by Japanese folk tales and mythology and an emphasis on cooperative combat and action.

We designed Legends to be an exclusively cooperative gameplay experience. You’ll be able to partner up with friends or via online matchmaking and play Legends in groups of 2-4 players. Each player can choose from one of four different character classes: the Samurai, Hunter, Ronin, or Assassin. Each class has unique advantages and abilities that we’ll reveal in the future.

With two players in Ghost of Tsushima: Legends, you’ll be able to play a series of co-op Story missions that escalate in difficulty, building on the foundation of combat from the single-player campaign but with new magical twists that often require careful synchronization with your partner.

With four players, you’ll be able to take on wave-based Survival missions, fighting groups of the toughest enemies Tsushima has to offer, Including new Oni enemies with supernatural abilities.

If you can best the Story and Survival missions, you may be confident enough to take on the four-player Raid that will arrive shortly after the launch of Ghost of Tsushima: Legends, sending you and your partners to an entirely new realm to challenge a brutal, terrifying enemy.

Source: [ The Publisher Website].

boardgame.name: The $10,000 Pyramid
boardgame.description:
Pair off in teams and get ready to climb the pyramid in this game show board game. Teams take turns selecting categories from the pyramid shaped board and then race against the clock as one player gives clues to the answers on the card. Correct answers turn into points, and whichever team has the most points after clearing the pyramid gets the chance to challenge the pyramid for their prize amount.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Fabulous Fred
boardgame.description:
A small electronic game with 9 colored buttons, a number of score/notepads, a few boards, and a box of chips and tokens. Contains 10 games to try; electronic organ, the music machine, what's that song?, memory game, mindbender, space attack, submarine hunt, catch the comet, baseball, and roulette.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Wipe Off Target Game
boardgame.description:
Wipe Off Target Game is a clone similar to Battleship featuring two space themed boards. Each board shows a planetary deployment grid on the left, and a radar scan grid on the right. Play is nearly identical to Battleship, but uses no pieces or tokens to denote positions. The game was designed to be used with wax crayons and ships were to be drawn on and wiped off as to make the game more accessible and portable.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Mickey Mouse Pop-Up Game
boardgame.description:
One of the four Whitman Pop-Up games. A simple spin and move children's game featuring Mickey Mouse and friends. The board depicts a pop-up rendition of the Magic Kingdom Castle and some hedgerows before the main gate. Use the first spinner to determine your pawn's movement and the second spinner to determine if your horse can jump this turn allowing you to use one of the shortcuts if you are lucky enough to come by one.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Wordy
boardgame.description:
A Scrabble-like game where instead of the tiles having values, they are instead color coded. The spaces of the board are also in various colors. Players take turns forming words using their hand of 7 letter tiles and those already on the board in a crossword-like fashion. Players score points for their words by comparing the colors of the letters in their words with the color chart, with tiles matching the color of their played spaces giving double points. The player with the most points after either all players can no longer go, or after one player have played their final tile and there is no more tiles to draw from.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Go Back
boardgame.description:
Go Back is a Milton Bradley vinyl indoor/outdoor game using a number of vinyl squares in red, blue, green, and yellow. The vinyl tiles are numbered 1 through 6 and are arranged in a 6x4 grid with each set of 4 containing 1 of each of the colors. Each round 1 player is the caller and will turn around and count to ten and then call a color to go back. All other players during the count must choose a color tile to put 1 foot on. If a player selects the same color as the caller calls, they have to go back to start, if not they advance to the next row. First player to make it to the last row gains a point and becomes the caller for the next round. First player to 7 points wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Mega Games 3
boardgame.description:
From Sega Retro:

Mega Games 3 is a compilation released for the Sega Mega Drive only in Europe in 1993. It was the last of three similar compilations, and was only distributed with Sega Mega Drive II consoles.

Games included:
Alien Storm
Super Thunder Blade
Super Monaco GP

boardgame.name: Mega Games 6
boardgame.description:
Source: [Sega Retro].

Mega Games 6 is a compilation of six Sega Mega Drive games, distributed with some European Mega Drive II consoles in 1995. It is actually a combination of two previous pack-in games, Mega Games 1 and Mega Games 2.

Games included:
Columns
Golden Axe
Super Hang-On
Streets of Rage
The Revenge of Shinobi
World Cup Italia '90

boardgame.name: Battle Force
boardgame.description:
Battle Force
This ruleset grants you the ability to play modern combat in any setting of your choosing, with any intended type or quality of troop you can imagine.
Whether you’ve decided to play a group of soldiers from the 101st Airborne Attachment, a poorly paid group of militia fighters, or a team of SWAT officers responding to a bank robbery, you’ll find the tools necessary to create a thrilling and narrative game experience.

The book contains the necessary markers to play the game.

Sequence of Play:

Start of Turn - resolve start of turn effects
Initiative Phase
Movement Phase
Action Phase
Reactive Movement Phase
Main Combat Phase
End of Turn - resolve end of turn effects + increment turn counter


—description from the publisher / rulebook

boardgame.name: Way of the Samurai: Blood and Bushido
boardgame.description:
Blood and Bushido is an expansion for Way of the samurai. It allows you to integrate new modules. Modules can be played individually or in combination. This expansion brings new game experiences and many strategic approaches.
Blood and Bushido includes 5 modules, a new opponent, 2 new surroudings, 2 new weapons, and a new random event map for campaign mode.
—description from the publisher (English)

Blood and Bushido est une extension pour le jeu Way of the samurai. Elle vous permet d’intégrer de nouveaux modules à vos parties. Les modules peuvent être joués de manière individuelle ou combinée. Cette extension apporte de nouvelles expériences de jeu et de nouvelles approches stratégiques face à l’adversaire. Blood and Bushido comprend 5 modules, un nouvel adversaire, deux nouveaux lieux, deux nouvelles armes, et une nouvelle carte événements aléatoires pour le mode campagne.

—description from the publisher (French)
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Way of the Samurai: Definitive Edition

boardgame.name: DiceWars
boardgame.description:
In space, no one can see you roll.

Dicewars is a lightweight game of deadly space combat that can be played anywhere you have polyhedral dice and a flat surface to play on.

To play Dicewars you’ll need a bunch of polyhedral dice, which you will use to make Starships.
Each player should have the same number of dice, but they don’t have to be the same types.
You’ll need at least one d20 per ship, and a few d6s for each one.

Dicewars is a quick tactical game that uses abstract positioning to represent swirling space battles on a flat surface with just the dice you probably have with you anyway (includes suggestions for making use of all sorts of weird and specialist dice you might have).
Play while you are waiting for your rpg group, play instead of your rpg, play instead of your more cumbersome wargames.

The ruleset includes full play references, diagrams, turn sequences, and suggestions on campaign rules.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Black Seas: Cutters Squadron
boardgame.description:
Cutters were usually tiny or small vessels with a single mast. Designed for speed more than transport capacity, the mast has a triangular aft (behind the mast) sail rigged fore and aft (from the front to the rear) and a headsail (a triangular sail rigged in front of the mast).

Though unable to compare in power to the heavily armed ships of the line, these vessels nevertheless played an important role in the Napoleonic Wars, ferrying supplies & troops, as well as carrying information around the fleet. Their swiftness made them especially suited for this latter purpose.

In Black Seas, Cutters are considered unrated ships with 2 broadside light cannons. They share the highest Rate of Knots value in the game and thus provide an extra dimension to gameplay as they zip about the ocean battlefield.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Xola
boardgame.description:
In Xola, you take control of the mighty Aztec Empire in the height of its power. Players have access to a wide variety of cards in order to impose their presence on the different cities surrounding the grand Aztec capital of Tenochtitlan. The player that has the strongest presence in the region wins the game.

Xola is a 2-4 player competitive game of domination. Matches take 20 to 30 minutes. Using a shared 100 card deck, players take turns and place cards on Aztec cities, increasing their power and dominance on the map. The game is played in rounds. After a round ends, new cities become available for the players to claim. The game ends when all cities on the map have been claimed. Whoever earns the most points wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: MegaCity: Oceania Alternate-Art Central City Tiles
boardgame.description: Alternate-Art Central City tiles with a heart in the center included in the AsmoPlay Ingenuity box. The box was released in January 2020

listing.notes: 1 Tile. Shipping worldwide: 1,50 Please read Seller info below.

boardgame.name: Velocity: Vanguard
boardgame.description:
You are the Vanguard… the first. Reach into the unknown with fledgling spacefaring technology and hopefully return to accolades. As Commander, your goal is to successfully complete your missions and discover what lies beyond Sol.

Velocity: Vanguard is a physics-based space board game with fast and kinetic gameplay. Story driven missions are designed for 1 to 4 players as individual commanders or teams. You’ll encounter asteroids, defense stations, powerful automated enemies, and many other surprises. Choose your faction, crew, ships and modules... then embark!

Through a unique physics based mechanic, players control where their ship will be by manipulating their vector token with a navigation action. Each ship has unique handling characteristics that make this an exciting part of gameplay.

Depending on the mission and mode (solo, co-op, competitive), each player controls a faction with 1 to 3 ships per faction, for a set number of rounds, or until a particular objective is completed. Within a round, each player will take turns activating ships by placing crew members in navigation, module or specialist crew action slots. After crews have been assigned, the player will move their ship on the tactical board the number of hexes and direction indicated by their vector token on the vector board. Before, during or after movement, players trigger crewed actions by spending energy and then exhausting that crew.

Your ships will be well equipped to explore, defend or attack with modules including weapons, defense systems, scanners, support and specialist crews. In the core game, each of the 3 ship classes possess unique strengths of their creator factions and are further customized by the player during mission setup. There are 18 modules and 12 specialist crews available to choose from in the core game. Each ship class can hold a limited number of modules and crew. Module and crew selection depends on the mission, and could include drafting, budget, free-for-all or recommended load-outs.

Whether you enjoy solo, co-op or competitive story driven missions, skirmish or building your own scenarios, Velocity: Vanguard has almost endless replay-ability.

boardgame.name: セブンヴァイス (-Seven Vice-)
boardgame.description:
セブンヴァイス (-Seven Vice-) is a Japanese card game based upon the seven deadly sins.

Players start with one card in their hand, then on their turn, draw one card and play one card. Each card type has its own special effects in the game.

Collecting sets of cards scores points. Getting four of a kind gets 1pt, getting the 7 different cards gets 2pts. The first to get to 3pts, wins the game.
user summary
